properties.description: Officers attempted to pull over Dowdy based on a false carjacking report filed by Erica M. Moore. Dowdy had fled in the car and then on foot, and was shot to death by officers when they thought he reached for his waistband. Moore recanted her story the day after Dowdy's death and received a felony charge of making a false offense report.[17]

properties.name: Thompson, Justin (15)
properties.description: The teenager was shot and killed by off-duty police officer Terrance Shaw. Police say Thompson had attempted to rob Shaw.[14]

properties.name: Haynes, Michael R
properties.description: Shot after shooting at officers. Police were responding to reported of armed mentally ill person.[108]

properties.name: Freeman, Christian (19)
properties.description: Freeman was shot to death by two officers after running towards them with a knife.[58]

properties.name: Stone, Larry
properties.description: Shot after failing to drop gun.[13]

properties.name: Thao, Vang
properties.description: 21-year-old Thao was killed by a stray bullet as officers fired at 18-year-old Kong Xiong, who was pointing a gun at them. Thao was not their intended target, and the Merced Police Department stated that Xiong was responsible for Thao's death.[16]

properties.name: Dilworth, Eric (38)
properties.description: Dilworth's brother called police when he believed his brother to be suicidal. When officers arrived, Dilworth allegedly ran out the back door with a knife. Four officers fired multiple shots at Dilworth, killing him, after he allegedly refused to drop the knife and continued towards them.[35]

properties.name: Benitez, Ricardo (47)
properties.description: Officer Brian Lueddeke shot and killed Benitez inside his home after he allegedly jumped toward the officer with a bread knife. Police say Benitez threatened his family and violated a court order, and the county prosecutor found the shooting justified. His wife and two sons filed a claim against the city.[34]

properties.name: Kelley, David (54)[11]
properties.description: Police were called to a home where a man reportedly armed with a knife was holding a woman hostage. The man refused to drop his knife or release the woman, and officers shot him to death.[12]

properties.name: Carlson, Kevin
properties.description: Undercover officers attempted to arrest Carlson on parole violations. When the officers turned on the flashing lights of their unmarked vehicle, Carlson and another man started shooting. The officers returned fire, hitting both men, and killing Carlson.[11][12]

properties.name: Allen, Michael Vincent (25)
properties.description: Officers attempted to stop a vehicle that matched the description of vehicle that had been involved in a previous chase. Allen led officers on a 30 minute chase that reached speeds of 100 mph. Allen turned into a cul-de-sac and an officer rammed his squad car into Allen's truck. According to a witness, the police yelled “Get out” then began shooting without giving Allen a chance to comply. Allen was unarmed. A single officer fired his weapon 41 times, requiring two reloads to do so.[1][2]

properties.name: Hernandez, Israel (18)
properties.description: At 5 a.m., Miami Beach police officers spotted Israel Hernandez spray-painting the side of a vacant McDonald's restaurant. After Hernandez saw police officers approaching him, he fled the area, leaving officers on a foot chase. According to Miami Beach police, Hernandez ignored the officers' commands to stop and then ran towards officer Jorge Mercado. An officer shocked Hernandez with a Taser, and he was unresponsive afterward. Hernandez was sent to a hospital and died at 6 a.m.[33][34]

properties.name: Herisse, Raymond
properties.description: Shot in vehicle after striking multiple officers and other vehicles with vehicle. Police were in the area due to annual Urban Beach Week celebration.[122]

properties.name: Simms, Johnny[178]
properties.description: Died in a shootout that also killed two Miami-Dade Police Department detectives, Amanda Lynn Haworth and Roger Castillo.

properties.name: Hilaire, Herson; Hilaire, Hedson
properties.description: Shot after striking a police officer with vehicle while fleeing home during a drug probe.[31]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Shot after stealing a police car and attempting to use it to run over a police officer. Deceased had recently fled scene of accident where he was driving vehicle that struck a taxi killing the driver.[48]

properties.name: Bueno, Manuel
properties.description: Shot after brandishing a knife.[129]

properties.name: Belizaire, Gibson
properties.description: Shot after firing at police officers multiple times.[44]

properties.name: unnamed famale
properties.description: Undercover officers responded to a report of a kidnapping. During the rescue a woman armed with a handgun was fatally shot by officers.[106]

properties.name: Williams, John T.
properties.description: List of cases of police brutality in the United States.[37][38][39]

properties.name: Redick, Larry
properties.description: Shot after firing at police who were responding to reports of a domestic disturbance.[86]

properties.name: Piirainen, Steven (52)
properties.description: State Trooper Paul Casey and Mexico Reserve Officer Dean Benson stopped Piirainen, who was suspected of stealing a truck. Piirainen was killed after an exchange of gunfire.[31]

properties.name: Hinojos-Maldonado, Jesus Eduardo (22)
properties.description: Officers were responding to a report of a man with a gun and attempted to subdue Hinojos-Maldonado with a Taser. Two officers opened fire on Hinjos-Maldonado, killing him, after he allegedly reached toward his waistband.[36][37]

properties.name: Chipman, Chris (49)
properties.description: A man in a wheelchair was killed after Mesa police shot him during an altercation. The man pulled out his gun and officers responded by firing shots.[38]

properties.name: Cullen, Kenneth (48)
properties.description: Cullen was shot to death by a SWAT officer outside his home after pointing a handgun in their direction. Police said he had asked officers to kill him.[47]

properties.name: Weatherspoon. Lynn
properties.description: Shot after fleeing SWAT team and reportedly pointing gun at them. The SWAT team was inside a black SUV and noted that Weatherspoon was armed with a handgun. Witnesses report that men jumped out of the SUV and opened fire as Weatherspoon ran away.[183]

properties.name: Delgado, Gerardo (56)
properties.description: Miami-Dade detectives and FBI agents were investigating a home at night when a man allegedly jumped out of a car and began firing at them. Officers returned fire, and Detective John Saavedera was injured and Delgado was killed. Gerardo had begun shooting when the officers approached Luis Lazaro Estevanell, who was taken into custody and charged with Delgado's murder, according to a family member.[2]

properties.name: Collins, Charles William (40)
properties.description: Collins was shot and killed in front of a pawn shop while allegedly driving his car in reverse toward detectives. Police said detectives were investigating Collins and that he told them he needed to get his ID from his vehicle when he attempted to flee.[63]

properties.name: Jones, Aiyana Mo'Nay Stanley
properties.description: Death of Aiyana Jones

properties.name: Green, Malice
properties.description: Malice Green

properties.name: Mulqueen, Tim
properties.description: Mulqueen entered the city courthouse and opened fired towards officers near the entrance. One officer was injured. Officers returned fire, fatally wounding Mulqueen.[22]

properties.name: Whittle, Lennord (25)
properties.description: Whittle, 25, was fatally shot Nov. 19 by two City of Middletown police officers — one male, one female — outside Sam's Food Mart on Academy Avenue in Middletown. Police had responded to a call that Whittle was menacing another man with a knife.[14]

properties.name: Dykes, Jimmy Lee (65)
properties.description: Six days earlier, subject killed a school bus driver and abducted a 5-year-old boy, then took refuge in an underground bunker on his property. After negotiations broke down, FBI SWAT team raided the bunker killing the subject.[19]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Shot after shooting at police. The man's vehicle was stopped as matching the description from a recent burglary.[74]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Officers responded to reports of an explosion in a woman's detached garage and a man in her yard who was an acquaintance of her husband. Officers arrived to find a shirtless man holding a machete and a rifle who "acted crazy." When the man pointed the rifle at officers, they fatally shot him.[34]

properties.name: Lofaro, Matthew
properties.description: Lofaro was shot and killed by a state trooper after refusing to drop his weapon while committing an armed robbery at a convenience store.[21]

properties.name: Nicholas Lister (31)
properties.description: Lister was killed by police after he fired one round at them in his apartment complex, according to investigators. The officers came there to investigate a domestic dispute involving Lister.[6]

properties.name: Hamilton, Dontre (31)
properties.description: An unnamed Milwaukee police officer confronted Hamilton, who was lying on the ground near Red Arrow Park in downtown Milwaukee. The officer claimed that Hamilton began beating him with the officer's own baton, at which point the officer drew his firearm and shot Hamilton 5 to 10 times. Hamilton was pronounced dead at the scene.[5]

properties.name: Williams, Timmie (36)
properties.description: Williams was shot to death by an officer after stabbing someone. The victim's mother, a witness, claimed the officer did not identify himself or speak to her son before he began shooting.[57]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Officers confronted a suspect regarding a recent theft. The man fled after attempting to run over the officers with his vehicle. Officers gave chase and fatally shot the suspect.[31]

properties.name: Foster, Brandon
properties.description: Shot by police after failing to drop gun. Witnesses say that it was possible that Foster was attempting to pull up his pants. His family says that he was on his way to sell his rifle.[5]

properties.name: Alexis, David (26)
properties.description: Suspect approached two detectives who were conducting surveillance with his arm behind his back. The two officers identified themselves as police. A fight ensued between the detectives and the suspect and the suspect was fatally shot. A firearm was found in his possession.[54]

properties.name: Johnson, Joeell Lee
properties.description: Shot after pointing a gun at an undercover officer during a robbery sting investigation.[42]

properties.name: Eugene, Rudy (31)
properties.description: Eugene shot to death by Miami police while eating the face of Ronald Poppo (both found naked), on the MacArthur Causeway.[10][11]

properties.name: Rieves, Shawn M. (17)
properties.description: Rieves, a suspect in an attempted carjacking, was shot and killed by police in downtown Milwaukee.[29]

properties.name: Tray, Michael (27)
properties.description: Tray was shot by police after allegedly pointing a revolver at them in a garage of an apartment complex.[20]

properties.name: Ortega, Victor (31)
properties.description: Officers began pursuing Ortega on foot after responding to a report of domestic abuse. An officer shot the man to death during a struggle when Ortega allegedly reached for the officer's gun. The officer shot him from about a foot away.[72]

properties.name: Williams Jr., Jessie Lee
properties.description: List of cases of police brutality in the United States.[59][60]

properties.name: Ramirez, Simon P. (30)
properties.description: Ramirez was shot and killed after allegedly pointing a firearm at officers during a traffic stop.[8]

properties.name: Collar, Gilbert Thomas (18)
properties.description: Collar was naked and banging on the window of the police station. Collar was acting erratically and repeatedly approached an officer who had gone outside to investigate. The officer shot Collar once in the chest.[39]

properties.name: Bedgood, Kenneth (36)
properties.description: Following stolen vehicle pursuit, Bedgood abandoned vehicle and fled on foot. Police say he shot at them, and they exchanged gunfire killing him.[35]

properties.name: Sheffield, Randy Lynn (54)
properties.description: Officers were responding to a stabbing. They found the suspect sitting in his vehicle. The suspect attempted to escape, but ended up hitting the front of a house. Officers shot and killed him when he tried to reverse in order to attempt to flee again.[61][62]

properties.name: Mendez, David (68)
properties.description: Detective Steve Anderson and Officer Ron Lemings went to Mendez's house to arrest him for a felony sex crime. When they arrived at the door, Mendez said he had a written confession to give them, and pulled a knife from a desk drawer and began stabbing himself. They ordered him to drop the knife, and after Lemings attempted to subdue him with a Taser, Detective Anderson shot Mendez, who died in a hospital two weeks later.[72]

properties.name: Rodriguez, Steven (22)
properties.description: Rodriguez had broken all of the windows in a restaurant with a metal bar when officers confronted him in the parking lot. An officer attempted to fire a taser at him, and Rodriguez allegedly approached that officer with the metal bar. Another officer fired 10 shots at Rodriguez, killing him.[14]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: An officer stopped a vehicle for impaired driving. When the officer approached the vehicle, the driver accelerated towards the officer who fatally shot him.[14]

properties.name: Rodriguez, Luis
properties.description: Police responded after Rodriguez' wife and daughter had an argument in the parking lot of the Warren Theater. After Rodriguez refused to show police his identification, they attempted to arrest him and Rodriguez resisted. Two on-duty Moore officers, one off-duty officer and two off-duty state game wardens were present during the altercation. Rodriguez stopped breathing during the beating and paramedics were unable to revive him. "When they flipped him over you could see all the blood on his face, he was disfigured, you couldn't recognize him," his daughter told journalists.[1][2]

properties.name: Castillo, Jesus
properties.description: Officers arrived at Moreno Valley Community Park after a report that a man had been harassing children near a restroom. Officers approached Castillo near a concession stand where a struggle ensued. Castillo allegedly attempted to choke the officer, who fired and shot Castillo to death. Hundreds of adults and children heard the gunfire.[115]

properties.name: Parks, Horace Lorenzo
properties.description: Shot after pointing gun at state trooper. Parks was being chased for driving a vehicle which matched the description from a recent shooting at a restaurant. The chase ended when Parks rammed a police vehicle.[142]

properties.name: McMurtry, Robert (50)
properties.description: Officers were responding to a report of a suicidal individual when a deputy shot McMurtry to death. He had allegedly threatened them with a machete.[121]

properties.name: Bell, Marcus (26)
properties.description: Bell was shot to death by SWAT team members after a 2 hour standoff at his apartment, where the man had locked himself in. Police had responded to a domestic disturbance call.[45]

properties.name: Franklin, Terrance (22)
properties.description: Franklin, a burglary suspect, was cornered in a basement by officers after fleeing police. A struggle ensued between Franklin and at least five officers and one K9, during which Franklin allegedly pulled the trigger on Officer Mark Durand's gun, shooting Officers Michael Meath and Ricardo Muro in the leg. An unidentified undercover officer shot Franklin multiple times, killing him.[27][28]

properties.name: Romero, Ivan (24)
properties.description: An officer, responding to the shooting involving Terrance Franklin, ran a red light and struck Romero's motorcycle, killing him and injuring his passenger.[27]

properties.name: Green, James Earl
properties.description: Jackson State killings

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Shot to death after allegedly pulling out a gun while an officer was patting him down. The man fired the gun at the driver of the vehicle, injuring him, and reportedly turned the gun at the officers, who shot and killed him. Police had pulled over a car containing five people and found that the unnamed man had an outstanding warrant.[35][36]

properties.name: Banks, Willie
properties.description: Shot after pulling out a pocket knife. Police were serving a bench warrant. Witness claim Banks was handing a box cutter to police.[49]

properties.name: Parera, Leonardo
properties.description: Shot after firing on police. Police were responding to Parera's call to 911 after Parera killed co-worker and threatened to escalate violence if approached.[42]

properties.name: Ramsey, Eric (30)
properties.description: Officers were searching for Ramsey as the prime suspect in a recent abduction, rape and arson. Ramsey rammed his vehicle into a squad car and fled in a stolen garbage truck. He was fatally shot by a sheriff's deputy.[24]

properties.name: Mesino, Abraham (40)
properties.description: Officers responding to a report of domestic violence arrived to find Mesino intoxicated and threatening his family. Mesino allegedly pointed a gun at a deputy, who shot and killed him.[34]

properties.name: Kaelber, Nicholas Allen (21)
properties.description: Late in the evening officers said they saw two men acting suspiciously; when they approached, one man fled. The officers pursued him and a struggle ensued, including shots fired at officers by Kaelber, according to police. One officer then shot Kaelber, who was pronounced dead at a hospital.[86][87]

properties.name: O'Donnell, Seth (26)
properties.description: Police responded to a report of a disturbance at a store. The suspect had a pair of scissors and was acting violently. O'Donnell slashed an officer's head with the scissors and was then fatally shot.[48]

properties.name: Smith, Malcolm
properties.description: Killed while fleeing from officers after shooting at them. Family members witnessed his death in the street in front of their home.[31]

properties.name: Jones, Reagan
properties.description: Reagan Jones barricaded himself in his apartment at Arbor Village Apartments after shooting and injuring his sister. Jones fired a high-powered military-style rifle at officers, and a Florence SWAT officer fired two rounds at Jones, killing him.[42]

properties.name: LaFave Jr, Derryl Cheyne, Kristopher
properties.description: Shot after robbing bank, killing an officer with vehicle while fleeing, and firing on police.[44]

properties.name: Bocock, John
properties.description: Shot after non-fatally shooting associate and refusing to drop weapon.[46]

properties.name: Ivie, Nicholas
properties.description: Ivie was on duty as a Border Patrol agent and responded to a report of a tripped ground sensor. Gunfire erupted, killing Ivie and injuring another agent. An FBI investigation determined that there “are strong preliminary indications” that Ivie was unintentionally killed by gunfire from a third agent.[52][53]

properties.name: Poccia, Richard
properties.description: Shot in front of his home by police after Richard's wife reported he was distraught and had threatened suicide.[14]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Shot after refusing to take hands out of pockets and while charging at deputy. Police were responding to report of man armed with knife attempting to break into a home.[110]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Police responded to report of a home invasion and found multiple people bound. A shoot-out ensued during which one burglar was killed and the other surrendered.[18]

properties.name: unnamed male (22)
properties.description: An officer fatally shot a man in the chest.[34]

properties.name: Quinonez, Jose (22)
properties.description: The 22-year-old Newark man was the target of a drug investigation. When Quinonez tried to flee the from the veteran detectives conducting the investigation, police shot and killed him. Eyewitnesses stated Quinonez was unarmed and walking to his mother’s house when an unmarked police car drove up behind him. However, police claim he was armed after finding a gun on the body.[39]

properties.name: Gracia, Malcolm (15)
properties.description: Shot to death by gang-unit detectives after an altercation with the officers that resulted in the Gracia stabbing one of the detectives with a hunting knife.[24][25]

properties.name: Robinson, Tamar
properties.description: Officers spotted Robinson trying to load stolen paving stones into his vehicle. As he fled, he was struck and killed by a marked squad car.[27]

properties.name: Gaymon, DeFarra
properties.description: Shot after reportedly lunging at police officer and threatening to kill him.[51]

properties.name: Peterson, Walter
properties.description: Shot after attempting to stab a police officer. Police had gone to Peterson's home to investigate a report of a broken window at a local store. Police unsuccessfully used a Taser before firing the fatal shot.[70]

properties.name: Deloatch, Barry
properties.description: Deloatch was shot by an officer while struggling on the ground with a second officer. The officer who fired the fatal shot was found to be in violation of the departments equipment policy by not having Oleoresin Capiscum (O.C.) spray on him. The officer resigned from the department following the internal investigation.[57]

properties.name: Green, James Lamont (27)
properties.description: An officer stopped his vehicle while he was fleeing from the scene of an earlier shooting. Green allegedly drove his car towards the officer while reaching for his weapon. The officer shot Green. Green died the following day in hospital.[90]

properties.name: White, Don (24)
properties.description: White, a car theft suspect, was shot and killed after driving towards a police officer.[32]

properties.name: Valerio, Jose (17)
properties.description: The shooting happened around 2 a.m. in the 2600 block of Dreux Street where three women -- ages 23, 24 and 27 -- were approached by a gunman while stopped to deal with a flat tire, NOPD said. The 25-year-old SUNO officer was with the women after they called him to help fix the flat. A SUNO officer was changing the tire when a car, possibly a Chrysler, approached and a gunman jumped out, pointed a gun at one of the women and demanded her purse, NOPD said in a news release. The woman handed over her purse. At that time, the officer "identified himself as a law enforcement officer," drew his gun and exchanged gunfire with the robber.[10]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Police responded to a disturbance at a 7-Eleven store. When officers tried to break up an altercation between the employee and a man, then man allegedly lunged at the officers with a sharp object. Officers opened fire on the man, who later died in a hospital.[11]

properties.name: Morris, Timothy Steven
properties.description: Shot after threatening to kill officer while having his hands in his pockets. A state trooper had attempted to stop Morris for speeding. Morris abandoned his vehicle and fled into a heavily wooded area where the trooper cornered him. Knives were found on Morris.[126]

properties.name: Wagner, Sonny (52)
properties.description: A single officer responded to a domestic violence call, met Wagner at the front door of his home. The officer reported he told Wagner to put the knife down, but he refused. Wagner then raised the knife and walked toward the officer. The officer then fired his service weapon twice, hitting Wagner in the chest. [36]

properties.name: Dasrath, Rexford (23)
properties.description: According to police, Dasrath was banging on the windows of their patrol car in Bushwick, Brooklyn. The officers exited the police cruiser, and Dasrath ran at them with a knife. Police then shot and killed Dasrath.[21]

properties.name: unnamed female
properties.description: Shot after refusing to drop knife and lunging at police officers. Police were responding to report of fight involving the deceased at a homeless shelter.[49]

properties.name: Bah, Mohamed (28)
properties.description: Bah was fatally shot by three officers as he was stabbing a fourth officer. Police were at Bah's apartment after receiving a call from his mother. Bah's mother was worried that her son might hurt himself or someone else. Police used a taser and rubber bullet prior to using their regular firearms.[12]

properties.name: Charles Mozdir (32)
properties.description: A suspected sex offender, Charles Mozdir, was fatally shot at a smoke shop in Greenwich Village, Manhattan, where he was employed. Two U.S. marshals and a New York police officer were also wounded during the attempted arrest, and may have been wounded by Mozdir's gun. Mozdir was featured on The Hunt With John Walsh.[3]

properties.name: Johnson, Jeffrey (53)
properties.description: Shot and killed by police at the Empire State Building while trying to flee after fatally shooting a former co-worker. Eight bystanders were wounded by police gunfire.[26][27]

properties.name: Wyatt, Rudolph
properties.description: Wyatt committed an armed robbery of a pharmacy. Police responded and shot at Wyatt as he fled. A retired and armed NYPD officer heard the shots and fired three times at Wyatt, hitting him twice in the head.[25]

properties.name: Hill, Tyjuan (22)
properties.description: An officer pulled the suspect's car over. When the car came to a stop, the driver got out and ran on foot. When the officer caught up to him, the two men struggled. At one point the officer fired his gun, fatally striking the man in the head.[30][31]

properties.name: Douse, Shaaliver (14)
properties.description: Shaaliver Douse was shot by NYPD after he fired a gun at another fleeing male on a Bronx street.[39]

properties.name: Kennedy, Darrius (51)
properties.description: Police approached Kennedy on suspicion of smoking marijuana in Times Square. Kennedy drew a knife, and started to walk away. The officers used pepper spray, but it failed to stop him. The officers shot and killed him, after he allegedly lunged at them with the knife.[81]

properties.name: Cairns, Justin (21)
properties.description: Mr. Cairns was a suspect in the killing of another man earlier in the day when officers tracked him to a house, confronted him, and he allegedly ignored their unspecified commands.[23][24]

properties.name: Rodríguez, José Antonio Elena (16)
properties.description: US Border Patrol agents witnessed suspected drug smugglers abandon a load of narcotics and flee back into Mexico. As the agents approached the border, people on the Mexican side of the border began throwing rocks at them. The agents ordered the rock throwers to stop. When they did not, one agent opened fire on the crowd. The US Border Patrol released a statement saying that Rodriguez “appeared to have been” shot by one of its agents.[36]

properties.name: Fuller, Darryl
properties.description: Shot after pointing a handgun at officers. Police were patrolling an area known for gang activity and approached a group of three men when Fuller drew a weapon.[144][145]

properties.name: Edwards, Alnur
properties.description: Shot during shootout with police following bank robbery, car jacking and chase.[58][59]

properties.name: David Latham (32)
properties.description: When police arrived at the scene of a domestic situation call, an officer encountered Latham, who allegedly threatened the officer with a knife. The officer discharged his firearm and hit Latham [33]

properties.name: Plato-Jacobo, Daniel (47)
properties.description: Plato-Jacobo had threatened to stab people with broken glass. Plato-Jacobo then went into his apartment and retrieved a kitchen knife. He was fatally shot after refusing to drop the knife.[87]

properties.name: Aho, Robert Elias (46)
properties.description: Aho was shot to death by officers after they were called to a home concerning a domestic disturbance. Upon arrival, officers said they learned a man inside had a gun and had fired one shot while they were on their way. Officers said the man then confronted them with the gun, and a deputy shot the man, who died later in the hospital.[88][89]

properties.name: Sermeno, Oscar
properties.description: Officers chased Sermeno, who had just shot and killed two people, down the Hollywood Freeway until he exited, where he allegedly "refused to comply with orders" and reached back into his car to pull out what officers supposed to be a handgun. Seven officers opened fire on Sermeno, who was pronounced dead at the scene. A stray bullet grazed a customer at a nearby 7-Eleven.[51]

properties.name: Overstreet, Joseph Dewey
properties.description: Shot to death by an officer after approaching him with a machete and refusing commands to drop the weapon. Police had responded to a 911 call from his wife, a witness to the event, who said she had called 911 hoping they would put him in jail overnight to sober up.[48]

properties.name: Zongo, Ousmane
properties.description: Ousmane Zongo

properties.name: Diallo, Amadou
properties.description: Amadou Diallo

properties.name: Busch, Gidone
properties.description: Gidone Busch

properties.name: Bell, Sean
properties.description: Sean Bell shooting incident

properties.name: Baez, Anthony
properties.description: Anthony Baez

properties.name: Stansbury, Timothy
properties.description: Timothy Stansbury

properties.name: Owens, Edgar (46)
properties.description: Owens was described by police as an emotionally disturbed person who attacked an officer without provocation. After being stabbed in the eye, the officer fired four times, killing Owens.[104]

properties.name: Cuevas, Reynaldo (20)
properties.description: Police responded to a burglary at a deli when a customer called 911. The burglary suspects attempted to flee through the back when police arrived. Cuevas, an employee, emerged from the front of the deli behind his manager and ran into a police officer, who fatally shot him. Police say they "believe it was an accidental discharge."[64]

properties.name: McBride, Michael (52)
properties.description: Officers were pursuing McBride as a murder suspect. McBride fired at officer who returned fire, killing McBride. 19 shots were exchanged in a crowded subway.[15]

properties.name: Fernandez, Eddie
properties.description: Police pursued a friend of Fernandez's who was riding a motorcycle the wrong way down a one-way street. The friend got onto the back of a motorcycle Fernandez was riding and they fled together. The police pursued in a squad car, accidentally rear-ending the motorcycle and killing Fernandez.[72][73]

properties.name: Brown, James Andrew (29)
properties.description: A Virginia teenager was shot and killed on the way home from a high school graduation, a police officer was gunned down, and another officer wounded by a raging ex-con who was later killed by police, authorities said.[6]

properties.name: Wilson, Tarika
properties.description: List of cases of police brutality in the United States.[23][24]

properties.name: Salameh, Taleb Hussein Yousef (28)
properties.description: Police responded to a 911 call reporting domestic violence. When they arrived at the scene gunshots were exchanged, and Salameh was shot and killed.[10]

properties.name: Bukowiecki, Richard (47)
properties.description: Bukowiecki committed suicide in a motel room. He had served on the Cerritos College campus police force for 26 years and was chief for the past eight. In 2012 he was awarded Outstanding Classified Manager.[28]

properties.name: Hernan Jaramillo (51)
properties.description: Killed in an unknown manner during an attempt by OPD to detain him for psychiatric evaluation. Immediately after Hernan was killed, the OPD told reporters that they had tried to detain him against his will for “psychiatric evaluation.” As the cops tried to stuff the 53-year old man in a police car, he resisted. Hernan’s life ended on the street, after police violently pulled him from his house and tackled him on the street. In other words, Oakland police beat Hernan to death in front of his own house. They never alleged that he’d done anything criminal.

properties.name: Rivers, Samuel
properties.description: Officers from the 111th Precinct responded to a call from a 17-year-old girl that her father was trying to commit suicide. Upon arrival, officers saw that Rivers had used a knife both on his wife and himself. After refusing to drop the weapon, officers shot Rivers in the neck and chest in an outdoor confrontation in the apartment courtyard. Mr. Rivers died and his wife Sharon was in critical condition.[32]

properties.name: Edwards, Elwood (22)
properties.description: Police were responding to a report of a disturbance at a convenience store where a man had allegedly hit someone over the head with a glass bottle and thrown a brick through a car window. Officers found Edwards about half a mile from the store and tried to detain him. Deputy Mike Astorga shot Edwards to death when he lunged at the officers with a stick.[16]

properties.name: Wilkerson, Marvin Donald (66)
properties.description: Officers responded to a report of a man threatening people with a gun. An officer fatally shot Wilkerson when he pulled a handgun from his waistband.[2][3]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Barricaded himself inside a home after allegedly shooting at police, who returned fire. When SWAT eventually entered the home, the man was dead. Police were responding to a domestic violence incident.[26]

properties.name: Williams, Joeshawn Edward (21)
properties.description: Police spotted Williams standing near a 7-Eleven store in the area, who then appeared to try to run away when approached by police. Police Sgt. Jimmy Cortez fired at Williams several times when Williams allegedly started shooting at Cortez.

properties.name: unidentified (??)
properties.description: K-9 Sgt. Ryan Stark fatally shot a burglary suspect who stabbed a his dog after it was set to attack him. The dog later died.[4]

properties.name: Domagala, Thomas Lars (27)
properties.description: The suspect was being tracked by a mult-agency fugitive task force. During a vehicle pursuit, the car he was a passenger in struck another vehicle. The suspect got out and ran on foot. When the suspect allegedly made a motion as if going for a weapon, one of the pursuing officers fatally shot him.[38][39]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: A man was killed after allegedly firing at officers who arrived at a home in response to a disturbance call.

properties.name: Jason Harrison (38)
properties.description: Police say Jason Harrions walked out of the door Saturday armed with a screwdriver. The two responding officers said they fired at the 38-year old mentally ill man when he refused to drop the screwdriver despite orders to do so and then charged at them. [23]

properties.name: Kenneth Johnson (34)
properties.description: According to Public Information Officer Aaron Patty, about 1:30 a.m., officers were attempting to pull over the man for a routine traffic stop near Ann Road and Camino Al Norte. The rider refused to stop for officers and led them on a pursuit, Patty said. The suspect ditched his vehicle at a home's front yard in the 700 block of Rio Royal Way and ran away. Police caught up with him in the 6000 block of Revere Street near Tropical Avenue, where an officer fired his gun, striking the man several times. According to NLV police, the man turned at officers at the time, confronted them and drew what looked like a black semi-automatic handgun. [11]

properties.name: Truelove, Bobby Joe
properties.description: An OKCPD officer was responding to several calls about vehicle break-ins at an apartment complex. During a struggle, the officer used a TASER on Truelove, but when that was not effective, he shot Truelove.[13]

properties.name: Stout, Stacy (20)
properties.description: Stout was shot and killed by OKCPD officers after attempting to flee the scene where a warrant was being served by US Marshals.[13]

properties.name: Street, Damion Lavent (33)
properties.description: Two county deputies were responding to a call about a man in the road with a knife. When the officers arrived, the man attacked one of them. After pepper spray and a taser were ineffective at stopping the attack, the second deputy shot and killed the suspect.[41]

properties.name: Bayliffe, Brent
properties.description: Shot after attacking an off-duty state trooper at the trooper's home.[30]

properties.name: Mayne, Thomas
properties.description: Shot after firing at federal agents who were attempting to arrest him.[29]

properties.name: Lucas, Jermaine (29)
properties.description: Lucas was on a 48-hour furlough from a correctional facility when he was shot and killed by officers. The officers were investigating gunshots when they spotted Lucas running down the street towards them. They ordered him to lay down on the ground. Lucas allegedly went for his weapon, and the two officers fired.[45]

properties.name: Hammond Jr., Samuel Middleton, Delano Herman Smith, Henry Ezekial
properties.description: Orangeburg massacre

properties.name: Alaya, Alex
properties.description: Alaya's mother called the police when she became concerned that her son may be suicidal. According to his family, Alaya was schizophrenic and having hallucinations, and was armed with a knife when police shot him to death. Neighbors said they heard officers yelling for the man to get down, and they heard about 5-8 shots.[110]

properties.name: Cambra, Lawrence (88)
properties.description: Police were responding to a house fire and a report of an armed person at the scene. After a responding officer was shot, more officers including two SWAT units responded to the scene. The alleged shooter fled to a nearby house and was eventually found and shot by SWAT team members, though he died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.[42][43]

properties.name: Chasse, James
properties.description: James Chasse

properties.name: Godinez, Maria Fernada (22)
properties.description: A suspect (Kody Roach[23]) and officers engaged in a shootout outside a bar in downtown Orlando. The suspect and a police officer suffered injuries. An innocent bystander woman (Godinez) was struck by an officer's bullet and died.[24]

properties.name: Gamble, Karvis (19)
properties.description: Gamble was shot in the stomach after drug-enforcement officers said someone in the building reached for a gun. Witnesses dispute the police account.[26]

properties.name: Muncie, Damien Jefferson (36)
properties.description: Muncie was shot an killed after allegedly wounding three police officers and attempting to break into the Valley Brook Municipal Building.[13]

properties.name: Stout, Christopher Lee (23)
properties.description: Stout was shot and killed by OKCPD officers after attempting to flee the scene where a warrant was being served by US Marshals.[13]

properties.name: Simms, Brian Jr. (24)
properties.description: Simms was shot and killed by off duty OKCPD officers working security for a concert. It was reported that Simms had a firearm in his waistband and failed to comply with the officers orders.[14]

properties.name: Howard, Robin Leander
properties.description: Howard died of "acute pneumonia caused by blunt force trauma to the chest" on June 23. His injuries occurred after an altercation with police. Howard led police on a chase after they attempted to pull him over for traffic violations.[40]

properties.name: Cooper, Kenneth Dewayne
properties.description: Cooper was shot and killed after officers responded to a possible disturbance call[1]

properties.name: King, Darnell (22)
properties.description: Darnell, an escaped inmate from the Oklahoma Department of Corrections, attempted an armed robbery of an off duty Oklahoma Highway Patrol Trooper at his home. After both individuals entered the home the trooper pulled his firearm and killed the suspect.[2]

properties.name: Ramirez, Robert
properties.description: Subject of possible drug overdose died in custody after arrest with physical force.[27]

properties.name: Unnamed male
properties.description: A man armed with a handgun was shot to death by police at a house. Another person was found shot to death near the scene.[26]

properties.name: Maupin, Travis (32)
properties.description: Officers responded to report of a domestic disturbance. Officers pursued Maupin on foot. Maupin resisted arrest. Shortly after the officers used a Taser gun on Maupin, he “coded”. He was taken to the local hospital where he died.[50]

properties.name: Gonzalez, Leonel Maldonado
properties.description: Died after being struck by vehicle driven by deputy. The deputy was following two cars when one car swerved sharply to left into the lane of an oncoming vehicle. The deputy saw something dark in his lane but could not avoid hitting Gonzalez.[15]

properties.name: Jennings, Joseph (18)
properties.description: Jennings had just been released from a psychiatric hospital three hours before two Ottawa police officers shot and killed him.[7][8]

properties.name: Mahoney, Michael (36)
properties.description: Police received calls about a man with a gun. When officers arrived at the scene, Mahoney had gone inside. Mahoney was shot after a standoff with police.[59]

properties.name: Zepeda, Jose (24)
properties.description: After a car chase in which the suspects allegedly brandished firearms at the officers. The two of the three suspects got out of the car and ran on foot. When the pursuing officers came under fire, they returned fire. Both suspects were shot, one fatally. An innocent bystander was also killed in the gunfire. It is not currently known if it was a suspect's or officer's bullet that killed him.[33][34]

properties.name: Robert Mroczek (46), Pammi Mroczek (49), Daniel Brennan (51)
properties.description: Parole officer Mroczek killed his estranged wife and boyfriend, then suicided after a police chase. [46]

properties.name: unnamed female (24)
properties.description: Officers responded to a report of a domestic disturbance. They found a woman holding a knife to the throat of her boyfriend. The officers shot her when she refused commands to drop the knife and “turned to stab him.” She died from her injuries.[41]

properties.name: DeVillena, Allan II
properties.description: A Marine was shot to death in a parking deck by two officers on bicycle patrol. The officers went to investigate when they heard a disturbance from two vehicles. Police say the man was not armed.[29][30][31]

properties.name: Scott, David (45)
properties.description: Officers responded to a reported domestic dispute. A man part of the dispute was fatally shot after pointing a gun at officers[7][8]

properties.name: Edwards, Josh (25)
properties.description: Edwards was killed in a police shoot out in a meth house. Three others were arrested. [2]

properties.name: unnamed male (27)
properties.description: The suspect got into a fight with a deputy responding to family dispute call. After hitting the officer in the head and attempting to choke him, the suspect allegedly went for the officer's pistol. At that point the officer fatally shot the suspect.[44]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Man was shot twice after attempting to take an officer's gun.[7]

properties.name: Holder, Ray (36)
properties.description: Police were called to a home regarding a domestic dispute. Holder allegedly answered the door with a weapon and began fighting the officer, Kevin Anderson, who shot him to death.[13]

properties.name: Wrana, John (95)
properties.description: Wrana allegedly threatened the staff at an assisted living center with a shoehorn and a kitchen knife, so a Park Forest, Illinois police officer tazered him, and shot him with a bean bag round.[7]

properties.name: McDade, Kendrec (19)
properties.description: The 19-year-old college student was killed by officers who opened fire on him in an alley, believing him to be the culprit of a robbery at gunpoint that had been called in that evening. McDade was shot multiple times in the chest and died in a hospital. Officers claimed McDade had motioned at his waistband, but the teenager was unarmed. The 26-year-old 911 caller, who later admitted to lying about the gun, was held by police for six days for suspicion of involuntary manslaughter and now faces deportation.[5] In December 2012, the shooters, Jeffrey Newlen and Matthew Griffin, were cleared of charges, although they are still facing a lawsuit in connection with the shooting.[6]

properties.name: Rosario, Salvador
properties.description: Police shot Rosario after he allegedly made a move toward them with a hammer. Officers had ordered him to drop the hammer in English, but Rosario only spoke Spanish.[86]

properties.name: Ruiz, Angel Francisco (42)
properties.description: Police shot and killed Ruiz after he allegedly threatened them with a replica firearm outside a restaurant.[5]

properties.name: Henninger, Joseph M.
properties.description: Shot by officers called to the scene for reports of a handgun being fired inside of a Les Schwab store.[23]

properties.name: Williams, Omarri (17)
properties.description: Three officers shot and killed Williams when he allegedly pointed a gun at them after shooting two other people. Officers were responding to an armed robbery call.[68]

properties.name: Coyle, Jamie (37)
properties.description: Police stopped Coyle because he matched the description of a man wanted in Massachusetts. Coyle allegedly pointed a gun at the officers, who then fatally shot him.[46]

properties.name: Robertson, Jonathan (32)
properties.description: Police were searching for two men who had committed a robbery the previous day. Robertson began shooting at officers after he was pulled over. An accomplice ran from the scene and was later arrested. Robertson fled in his vehicle and continued firing his weapon until police were able to overcome him.[6]

properties.name: Pickard Jr., James (51)
properties.description: A man in a stolen car advanced towards a police car, and officers fired at him.[66]

properties.name: Abrams, Terrance Lamar (23)
properties.description: Officers were responding to a call about a shooting. They spotted the suspect a few blocks away and ordered him to the ground. The suspect failed to comply, and shot at officers, who fatally shot him.[37][38]

properties.name: Kirkland, James
properties.description: Officers were responding to an armed disturbance call when they shot and killed Kirkland, who was reportedly attempting suicide prior to their arrival. Officers said Kirkland lowered his gun at them.[100]

properties.name: Williams, Arvel Douglas (30)
properties.description: Harford County sheriff's deputies used Tasers on 30-year-old Arvel Douglas Williams "in an effort to safely place [him] under arrest," Baltimore County Police said Thursday. Police did not say how many deputies used Tasers, or how many times Williams was stunned.[18]

properties.name: Ellis, David (29)
properties.description: Man killed in police shoot out. Officer Steve Korpalski, a 14-year-veteran, grazed in the left side of his head by a bullet.[19]

properties.name: Banks, Darrell (47)
properties.description: Plain clothes officers in an alley were investigating an armed home invasion when they spotted a man who matched the suspect's description. The man fled. Police report they fatally shot him when he pointed an object at them. No weapons were recovered at the scene. Family members report Banks was walking home from a birthday party.[47]

properties.name: Torres, Jose (18)
properties.description: Officers were dispersing a crowd gathered around a bar when Torres fled, dropping a pistol on the ground. Officers pursued Torres, and one officer shot and killed him when he believed the young man was reaching into his waistband for another weapon. A second gun was not recovered.[48]

properties.name: Pinkney, Adolphus
properties.description: Shot after ignoring command to drop weapon and then firing on police.[39]

properties.name: unnamed male (34)
properties.description: The man was shot after pointing a gun at police.[22]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Police responded to a report of a disturbance to find two men arguing. One of the men had a knife and turned and threatened an officer, who then shot and killed him.[23]

properties.name: unnamed person
properties.description: An officer stopped a vehicle for driving recklessly. The driver fled, dragging the officer who fired multiple times. The driver was taken to a hospital and later pronounced dead.[31]

properties.name: Henderson, Matthew (28)
properties.description: Henderson was shot to death by officers after getting out of his car with a gun and pointing it at a police sergeant.[65]

properties.name: unnamed male (35)
properties.description: Officers stopped a suspicious man riding a bike. The man was holding a gun, which the officers ordered him to drop. He refused and resisted it being taken away. When he pointed the gun at an officer, an officer opened fire. The man was shot once in the chest and pronounced dead at the scene.[24]

properties.name: Doll, Steve Matthew (40)
properties.description: Doll was shot by California Highway Patrol officer Officer Ben Schiesser after chase by car and on foot.[78]

properties.name: unnamed male (32)
properties.description: Police say they responded to a domestic violence call to find a man with a knife to his girlfriend's neck. An officer shot and killed the man after he allegedly lunged at officers with a knife.[4]

properties.name: McCully, John Timothy
properties.description: Shot after threatening officers with "large kitchen knife" and refusing to drop it even after being shot with stun guns.[2]

properties.name: Gammage, Johnny
properties.description: Johnny Gammage

properties.name: Murray, John (31)
properties.description: An officer confronted Murray, believing that he matched the description of a man wanted for a home invasion. Police say Murray was armed with a knife and that a struggle ensued. The officer fired one round, killing him.

properties.name: Sok, Vanna (24)
properties.description: An SUV pulled up to a street corner and, after a short confrontation, began shooting. Sok, who had a registered gun, fired back at the vehicle. A nearby officer then shot Sok, who had his back turned, without warning from inside a police car, according to several witnesses. Police say the officers stepped out of the car and Sok turned around and pointed the gun at them before they shot him in the head.[59]

properties.name: Newsuan, Kenado (31)
properties.description: An officer responded to report of a naked man in the road. The officer reported that the man appeared to be on drugs and attempted to subdue him with a Taser. A scuffle ensued during which the officer's gun holster was ripped from his pants. The officer fired five times, striking Newsuan three times. Newsuan was pronounced dead at a local hospital.[8]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Police shot and killed a man who allegedly refused to drop a weapon. This incident marked the seventh person shot by police in Philadelphia in one week.

properties.name: unnamed male (21)
properties.description: Police killed a man when he allegedly pulled out a gun while they were pursuing him for an unspecified reason.

properties.name: Riedisser, Justin Tyler (26)
properties.description: Several officers shot and killed Riedisser after he allegeldy pointed a gun at them. Police were initially responding to a domestic violence incident at an apartment. They tracked Riedisser to another location less than a mile away before killing him.[18]

properties.name: unnamed male (19)
properties.description: Officers responding to report of domestic violence arrived to find a woman with multiple gunshot wounds in front of the home. When a man at the scene pointed a gun at officers, they shot him. He died at the scene from a single gunshot wound.[20]

properties.name: Brown, Raymond (28)
properties.description: A citizen flagged down officers in a patrol car and reported a man waiving a gun in front of a hospital. When the officers commanded Brown to drop his weapon, he fired at them. An officer fired back, striking Brown once in the thigh. Brown was rushed to the hospital and later died of his wound.[40][41]

properties.name: unnamed male (33)
properties.description: Officers responded to a report of a man with a gun. When officers arrived the man pointed the gun at the officers. When the suspect ignored orders to drop the weapon, he was shot multiple times. He died at a local hospital.[33]

properties.name: unnamed male (50s)
properties.description: Officers responded to report that a man had pointed a gun at mother and child. When officers arrived, the suspect fled in a vehicle. When the officers located the suspect a few blocks away, the suspect fired at the officers at least twice. The officers returned fire, killing him.[53]

properties.name: Garnett, Mario Edward (40)
properties.description: Garnett was a suspect in a spree of attempted bank robberies that began in Atlanta, followed by another in Mississippi hours later, where two officers were shot and one was killed. Nearly a week later, Garnett was shot to death by a detective after allegedly shooting at officers while robbing a bank in Phoenix.[1]

properties.name: Cusseaux, Michelle (50)
properties.description: Michelle Cusseaux, a woman with mental illness was shot and killed by Phoenix police after her family and mental health workers called for police assistance.[39]

properties.name: Steven Brandt
properties.description: A man named Dan Ruble called police to say that Brandt, his girlfriend's estranged husband, was in his driveway with a gun. Ruble was at work when he learned that Brandt was at his home, and met police at a family member's house. The officer asked Ruble to accompany her to his home. When they arrived, Brandt opened fire on Ruble, killing him, and the officer shot and killed Brandt.[5]

properties.name: Jimenez, Vincent
properties.description: Officers attempted to stop a driver who seemed impaired. The driver fled and led officers on a chase that ended at the suspect's home where he crashed into a retaining wall. When officers approached the driver, the suspect rammed two cruisers and accelerated towards officers who opened fire. The suspect was pronounced dead at the scene. A five-year-old child was discovered unharmed in the passenger seat.[42]

properties.name: Lara, Hector
properties.description: Officers from a "multi-agency task force" were executing a search warrant when a suspect allegedly opened fire. Officers fired back and the man was shot to death.[7][8]

properties.name: Valenzuela, David
properties.description: Shot after ignoring commands to drop weapon and pointing gun at police. Police were responding to reports of gunshots and assault at bus terminal.[41]

properties.name: unnamed female
properties.description: Police were responding to a report of a man holding people hostage inside a home, and when they arrived they encountered a woman in the front yard holding a gun. After some sort of confrontation, officers fired multiple shots at the woman, killing her. Nine people were inside the home but police found no indication they were being held hostage.[9]

properties.name: unnamed male (54)
properties.description: Shot numerous times by an officer after allegedly pointing a handgun at two officers. The 54-year-old man was suspected of holding his estranged wife and her boyfriend hostage.[25]

properties.name: Cisneros, Santiago A., III (32)
properties.description: Cisneros was shot and killed by Officers Brad Kula and Michele Boer in a parking garage after allegedly firing a shotgun at them.[25][26]

properties.name: Morgan, Brad Lee (21)
properties.description: Morgan called 911 saying he had committed a robbery and was going to jump off a building. He told the dispatcher he might be armed. Two officers located him atop a parking garage, and when they approached Morgan he pointed a black handgun at them. The officers shot him to death. The gun turned out to be a toy that had been spray painted.[9]

properties.name: Simms, Billy Wayne (28)
properties.description: Police were responding to a report of a shooting when Officer Justin Clary shot and killed Simms, whose car then crashed into an exterior wall of an apartment.[18]

properties.name: Isadore, Monroe (107)
properties.description: Police arrived at a residence in response to reports of a disturbance. Isadore confronted them with a handgun and retreated into a bedroom, firing on them when they attempted to enter. SWAT officers arrived as backup and, after failed negotiations, released gas into the room and broke down the door. Isadore fired on them as they entered, and they returned fire, killing him.[30]

properties.name: Armstrong, Justin (28)
properties.description: Armstrong, an armed shooting suspect, shot in Hon-Dah casino parking lot.[75][76][77]

properties.name: Oregero, Joseph Paul (57)
properties.description: Killed by SWAT team after barricading himself inside an RV.[43][44]

properties.name: Kirk, Beverly (43)
properties.description: A police officer in a marked car with lights and siren off was following an ambulance with lights and siren on. The officer struck Kirk when she “failed to yield the right of way to the marked police car.”[15]

properties.name: Banks, William (26)
properties.description: Police were searching for a man who robbed a couple at gunpoint, then fled in a vehicle. Police gave chase to a matching vehicle. Banks fled on foot. When police caught up to Banks, he turned and confronted them with a handgun. Several officers fired multiple times. Banks died at a hospital.[17]

properties.name: Havard, Bryan Reyes
properties.description: Police were led on a high-speed chase by Havard, an oil field worker, after trying to pull him over for a traffic violation. Havard then fled on foot into a casino, allegedly with a pistol, where he was shot to death by officers.[95]

properties.name: Doerbecker, Kurt
properties.description: Shot after refusing to drop knife and approaching police in a threatening manner. Police were responding to reports of a disturbance at a bar.[73]

properties.name: Otis, Keaton Dupree
properties.description: Shot after shooting at and wounding police officer during traffic stop. Use of Taser was ineffective.[65][66]

properties.name: Donohue, Russell (44)
properties.description: Russell Donahue attempted to break into a home and shot through the door. Officers were called onto the scene, and two deputies fired at Donohue, killing him.[21]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: A man was shot and killed by Port Hueneme police during a traffic stop.[31]

properties.name: Muppa, Vishwaja (21)
properties.description: An officer responding to a call without lights on ran into the side of another vehicle at an intersection. All persons involved in both vehicle were injured. Muppa died of her injuries.[5]

properties.name: Okot, David
properties.description: Shot after brandishing handgun. Police were responding to report of intoxicated man with handgun.[76]

properties.name: Swoboda, Kelly (49)
properties.description: Robbery suspect Swoboda was shot and killed by police; family reported he had addictions and mental illness. [9]

properties.name: Lanza, Mark (23)
properties.description: Lanza fired shot at police who arrived at a condominium complex responding to a call of a burglary, and officers returned fire.[83]

properties.name: Herrera-Garcia, Mauricio (39)
properties.description: Herrera-Garcia left the scene of an auto accident and then fired several shots into the air when the accident victim tried to contact him. According to police, Phoenix Police Department SWAT team members fatally shot him after he pointed a handgun at an officer as they tried to apprehend him. Herrera-Garcia was Latino. [9]

properties.name: Barnes, Samuel William (49)
properties.description: Officers were responding to a domestic dispute call when they encountered Barnes pointing an AK-47 at his wife. Officers shot him when he refused to lower the weapon. After being hit, Barnes pointed the weapon towards one of the officers, and the officer fired a second time. Barnes died later at the hospital.[20]

properties.name: O'Brien, Timothy Sean
properties.description: O'Brien, 25, was allegedly threatening people, including children, with a baseball bat after being denied access to a swimming pool. When officers responded, O'Brien moved towards them while swinging the bat. After repeated warning to stop and drop the bat, the two officers shot and killed O'Brien.[70]

properties.name: Castello, Luke (22)
properties.description: Police shot and killed Castello, a robbery and attempted kidnapping suspect, after displaying a handgun towards the officers during a car chase.[13]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Officers responded to a report of a domestic disturbance. As the officers arrived, the suspect fired at police with a handgun, then fled through the rear of the house. Officers in the alley confronted the suspect and fatally shot him.[7]

properties.name: Fuller, Daniel Ross (46)
properties.description: Police SWAT were responding to a report of an armed suicidal man. Gunfire was exchanged; one officer was reportedly shot in the arm, and the suicidal man was killed.[41]

properties.name: Travis, Deshone (20)
properties.description: Travis was shot to death by officers while inside his car. A police investigation of a robbery led to a home where Travis' car was parked. Travis called his father to tell him that police wanted to impound his car for something related to a robbery, and his father told his son he would come talk to them. When he arrived, his son was dead. According to the resident of the home, police had wanted to search the car but had given Travis back the keys. Travis began to back away and an officer shot him three times from behind the car.[20]

properties.name: Clay, Larry (44)
properties.description: Police responded to a suicidal suspect call. Clay was fatally shot when he reportedly charged officers while holding two knives.[12]

properties.name: Shirrel, Dustin Lee (30)
properties.description: Police attempted to pull over a vehicle that Shirrel was a passenger in, because it appeared to be stolen. The driver fled, and after five miles crashed the car. Shirrel ran on foot into nearby woods. The driver surrendered, and told the officers that Shirrel was armed. Later he stepped out of the woods and allegedly brandished a handgun. Officers from three different agencies opened fire, killing Shirrel.[54]

properties.name: Valdez III, Edward (21)
properties.description: Police say a man on a bicycle was shooting out car windows with a BB gun early in the morning. When an officer approached the man, he allegedly fired at an officer, striking him, and the officer shot him to death.[9][10]

properties.name: McIntyre, George
properties.description: McIntyre was wanted for questioning by Pullman police concerning an assault. He shot and killed officer Ross Klaar when Klaar attempted to arrest him. McIntyre ran away from the scene but was later found by other officers. A gun battle ensued, during which three law enforcement officers and McIntyre died.[126]

properties.name: Majewski, Dennis Jason William
properties.description: Shot to death by officers after threatening to go on a "killing spree". The man was armed with a knife and a hammer.[38][39]

properties.name: Baker, Samuel
properties.description: Died from a spinal cord fracture and dislocation Baker suffered when he fell to the ground after being “tased.” Police were responding to report of man with knife. Upon being confronted by police, Baker “flashed the officers his knife”, at which point the officers used the Taser on Baker.[28][29]

properties.name: McCall, Sandy James (33)
properties.description: Police were investigating a report of a suspicious person when they encountered McCall. Sgt. Samuel Morant shot and killed McCall during an altercation.[4]

properties.name: Brown, Christopher (17)
properties.description: An off-duty police officer heard a loud bang at his door. He opened the door to find it damaged by a rock and teens fleeing. The officer gave chase and caught one teen who was wearing a leg brace. A fight between the two ensued. The state medical examiner ruled the teen's death a homicide by asphyxiation.[54]

properties.name: Geske, Troy
properties.description: Died from “positional asphyxia” while being restrained face down in police custody in the forensic unit of the state mental hospital.[45][46]

properties.name: Elmore, Robert
properties.description: Shot after answering door with gun in hand and pointing it at officer. Police were responding to report of a loud disturbance at Elmore's home.[158]

properties.name: Wolford, William
properties.description: Died from injuries sustained when struck by police cruiser. Officer was stopped at red light and struck Wolford as he crossed intersection at crosswalk. Officer was initially cited for careless driving causing bodily injury.[65]

properties.name: Tavares, Christopher (21)
properties.description: Officers were investigating a neighborhood after hearing gunfire. They pursued a suspicious vehicle that crashed after a short chase. A passenger in the vehicle shot an officer in the shoulder and three people fled in different directions. Officers found the shooting suspect less than an hour later. They fatally shot Tavares when he refused to listen to the officers' commands and attempted to flee. The two other persons in the vehicle were arrested.[51]

properties.name: Harold Murphy (35)
properties.description: The suspect attempted to run from the officer after being stopped for illegal use of an ATV, and a second officer who was on scene pursued him a short distance. As the second officer tackled the suspect, Harold Murphy began firing a handgun he had in his possession. [37]

properties.name: Sampson, Eric G.
properties.description: Shot after refusing to lay down a machete Sampson had used to strike an officer's cart. Sampson was pulled over in a routine traffic stop then fled in vehicle. Sampson was found near registration address of vehicle. Use of Tasers was ineffective.[150]

properties.name: Long, Robert
properties.description: Long was in his front yard when Officers, responding to a "shots fired" call, arrived. Long was armed with a rifle and threatened to kill his roommate and officers. Officers fired when Long pointed the rifle at them.[23]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Shot after confronting officers with a knife. The man had broken into his own home using a brick at which point the babysitter called police. Officers twice attempted to subdue man with Taser.[77]

properties.name: Deen, Scott Joseph (19)
properties.description: Deen was shot and killed during a struggle with officers where he allegedly attempted to stab an officer. Police said stun guns were ineffective. Deen had reportedly been siphoning gas from cars in a neighborhood.[29]

properties.name: Ray Dakota Scholfield (22)
properties.description: reportedly brandished a butcher knife at police[14]

properties.name: Reece, Julias Michael (20)
properties.description: An armed man suspected in a series of carjackings in Redford and Detroit was shot and killed by police on New Year’s Day.

properties.name: Cox, Ronald Jr. (48)
properties.description: Cox was shot and killed after swinging a sword at officers who confronted him in a bedroom of a home. Police were executing a warrant to arrest Cox's niece.[68]

properties.name: Anthony Gustave Nelson (40)
properties.description: A suspect in a Tucson homicide was shot to death by deputies in Nevada after he killed two women near Reno, law enforcement officials said. Anthony Gustave Nelson, 40, was killed June 13 in a shootout with officers in Nevada. [26]

properties.name: Herndon, Jace (41)
properties.description: Herndon was pulled over for driving a stolen vehicle. After exiting the vehicle, he allegedly refused to comply with the officers orders, and attempted to escape. Officers then fired and fatally wounded him.[20]

properties.name: Prine, Deborah (42) Prine, Robert (50)
properties.description: A man and woman were shot and killed during an altercation with police at a trailer park. Police say they were armed. This incident occurred during Hurricane Isaac (2012).[12][13]

properties.name: O'Connor, Jeffrey (25)
properties.description: Officers were responding to a disturbance and possible hostage situation. When police arrived, they encountered a man with a knife and shot him.[44][45]

properties.name: Schultz, James Dean
properties.description: Shot during confrontation with police who were responding to report of a suspicious person.[118][119]

properties.name: Munoz, Sergio (39)
properties.description: Munoz, suspected of murdering a woman and wounding a man in Ridgecrest, was shot and killed by seven police officers during a car chase in the Mojave Desert. He fired on vehicles and held hostages in his car. The hostages were flown to a hospital in critical condition after being shot by Munoz.[12][13]

properties.name: Scrivner, Curtis
properties.description: Shot during shootout with deputy. Officers were searching for Scrivner after he had displayed a firearm and fled when contacted by a deputy regarding a felony warrant in Colorado.[16]

properties.name: Keith, Craig
properties.description: Police responded to a call from security officers at a casino regarding a disturbance. Keith, who had been drinking, fled in an SUV, with numerous officers pursuing him across three counties. After officers used stop-sticks to force him to stop, Keith exited the vehicle and officers opened fire, killing him. Police say he did not obey commands. He was unarmed.[49]

properties.name: Watson, Steven L
properties.description: Officers responded to a report of a man firing a gun. Watson pointed a gun at officers after being told to drop it. He was shot multiple times and pronounced dead at a local hospital.[29]

properties.name: Moore, Michael (56)
properties.description: Officers responded to a report of disturbance between neighbors. Officers arrived to find Moore shooting at another person. Moore refused to put down the weapon and was shot. He was pronounced dead at a local hospital.[23]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Police were responding to a domestic disturbance call. An officer shot and killed a man from whom he "perceived a threat."

properties.name: Ledezma, David (52)
properties.description: Ledezma was shot to death by officers at his home after he threatened to kill himself with a knife and then threw pipes in their direction. Three officers fired 18 shots. Police had been called by a relative after Ledezma had allegedly struck his wife that day.[27]

properties.name: Miller, Tyisha
properties.description: Shot dead by police officers called by family members who could not wake her as she lay unconscious in a car. [103]

properties.name: Bond, Danny James (38)
properties.description: Two officers tried to stop Bond on his bicycle to arrest him on outstanding warrants, and he fled on foot. Two officers shot him to death after he allegedly pulled out a pistol.[10]

properties.name: Harmon, John (50)
properties.description: Police responded to a report of a man wielding a knife abroad a light-rail train. Police confronted Harmon and were unable to restrain him with a tazer. Harmon then charged towards the officers with his knife and was shot several times.[13]

properties.name: Moore, James Russell (64)
properties.description: An officer stopped Moore for suspected impaired driving. The officer noticed a gun in Moore's pocket and ordered him to the ground. Moore pulled the handgun out of his pocket and pointed at the officer who fatally shot him.[4]

properties.name: Andino, Israel (20)
properties.description: Andino was shot to death by seven officers called to his home when he stabbed his mother. Andino was diagnosed with bipolar disorder and had not taken medication that day, but according to family had never been violent before. His mother says she tried to explain his situation to officers. The 20-year-old was armed with a handgun, which officers say he fired but witnesses claim he did not. It was the young man's birthday.[32]

properties.name: Bell, Logan (18)
properties.description: Bell was spotted by police carrying what appeared to be a firearm. Bell ran from police. When the officers caught up to him and told him to drop the weapon, Bell allegedly raised the gun up. Bell was shot multiple times, and died from his wounds. The weapon he was carrying was a pellet gun.[35]

properties.name: Worley, Kevin (25)
properties.description: Worley was a suspect in recent home invasions. An officer spotted him sitting in a car at a gas station. When the officer approached and ordered Worley to show his hands, Worley pulled out a gun. Worley was fatally shot when he allegedly pointed the weapon at the officer.[11]

properties.name: Guerra, Jose Alberto (19)
properties.description: An officer responded to a report of a suspicious person walking in the middle of the road. Witnesses saw Guerra and the officer struggling on the side of the road. Guerra allegedly attempted to push the officer into traffic. The officer shot Guerra three times. Guerra died at a local hospital.[29][30]

properties.name: Eng, Jazmyne (40)
properties.description: Jazmyne Eng, a 40-year-old Asian woman, was shot and killed by sheriff's deputies Wednesday, Jan. 4, in the 9300 block of East Valley Boulevard in Rosemead, according to Los Angeles County coroner's records. Eng appeared to be mentally ill as she held a hammer and allegedly threatened to strike people outside a mental health clinic Wednesday afternoon.[30]

properties.name: Storey, Paul Lawson (35)
properties.description: Suspect was fleeing from the scene of a domestic dispute. When an officer caught him and attempted to arrest him, a struggle ensued. A second officer, fearing for the safety of the other officer, fatally shot the suspect.[23]

properties.name: Ceja, Pedro Salgado
properties.description: Shot while chasing police with shovel in hand. Officer was responding to report of domestic violence and was attempting to arrest Ceja for investigation of second-degree assault and unlawful imprisonment.[33]

properties.name: Toretti, John (42)
properties.description: Police were called when a man frightened a Metro PCS employee with "intelligible(sic) statements." A struggle ensued with the officers, and the man was pepper-sprayed, kicked, and repeatedly beaten with batons. Officers noticed he had stopped breathing once he was in police custody.[10][11]

properties.name: Hirsch, Walter (54)
properties.description: Officers were responding to a call about a suicidal person. An officer-involved shooting occurred, and the person was killed.[43]

properties.name: Hall, Milton (49)
properties.description: Police were called to a shopping center by gas station employees complaining of Hall's behavior inside the store. A thirty minute confrontation between officers and Hall, who had a knife, ended with officers shooting him to death. Officers fired over 40 rounds at Hall, who was reportedly homeless.[113][114]

properties.name: Jimenez, Hector (50)
properties.description: Police responded to a call of a man in his yard holding a knife acting bizarrely. He was shot when police claim he lunged towards officers with the knife.[25]

properties.name: Dunbar, Brandon James (26)
properties.description: Dunbar was killed during a foot chase after he fled a traffic stop. He allegedly turned toward the officer while holding a gun, and the officer shot him to death.[26]

properties.name: White, Scott
properties.description: Shot after a seven-hour standoff outside White's former wife's home.[43]

properties.name: Hernandez, Osman (26)
properties.description: Multiple 911 callers told emergency dispatchers that Hernandez was chasing random people around a crowded shopping center with a knife. Business owners barricaded themselves inside their shops. The fieldworker had walked to the shopping center from a nearby bar, where he had drank alcohol heavily for at least two hours and got into a bar brawl. The first officer on scene saw Hernandez was acting bizarrely. Surveillance video showed Hernandez wildly swinging his knife around in the air. He did not follow officers' directions whatsoever and the shopping center was crowded, with people walking everywhere and businesses still open. While officers were handcuffing him, Hernandez blew a kiss to the officer who was trying to handcuff him, said in Spanish, "Please forgive me," and quickly grabbed his knife. It was at that moment that police opened fire. [18]

properties.name: Mejia, Carlos (44)
properties.description: Officers responded to reports from a resident of Elkington Avenue at 12:14 p.m. that a man, identified as 44-year-old Carlos Mejia, was trying to break into their home and was threatening to kill them, police said. When police arrived, they soon found Mejia walking down Del Monte Avenue holding garden shears, pointing the shears at them and refusing to put the instrument down as the officers, speaking Spanish, commanded him to do. The officers attempted to use their Tasers on the suspect to subdue him, but the cartridge from one officer’s Taser missed hitting Mejia and the other officer’s Taser did not work. The two officers decided to use deadly force on Mejia to prevent him from possibly harming people inside a bakery as he approached the entrance to the business at the corner of Del Monte and Sanborn[16][17]

properties.name: Mayhew, Anthony (37)
properties.description: Mayhew was in a 2-hour standoff with police that started with a bomb scare at a downtown bus station. Mayhew was fatally shot when he allegedly stopped listening to the officers commands and started to approach them.[8]

properties.name: Simons, Kelly Fay (38)
properties.description: Shot and killed by police after allegedly driving toward a JCAT (Joint Criminal Apprehension Team) officer. Police say she was a suspect in a series of robberies.[39]

properties.name: Barrett, Brandon
properties.description: Shot after shooting at police and injuring one officer in the leg. Police were responding to report of man armed with a rifle pacing on a busy street.[40]

properties.name: Luis, Gilbert (24)
properties.description: Officers responded to a report of a domestic disturbance. Luis advanced on them with a knife. Officers shot him multiple times. He died at a local hospital.[44]

properties.name: Torres, Javier (50)
properties.description: Officers arrived at Torres' home after he called a crisis hotline regarding his contemplating suicide.
