Torres was not there, but police found him walking down a road carrying a handgun. As the officers approached Torres, he fired at them. They returned fire. Torres died at a local hospital.[17]

properties.name: Miller, Gregory Clark (52)
properties.description: Officers responded to report of a family disturbance. Miller advanced towards the officers swinging a machete. Miller was shot once in the chest and died at the scene.[42]

properties.name: Soto, Mario (41)
properties.description: Plainclothes officers approached Soto as the prime suspect in recent armed robberies. Soto pulled a handgun from his waistband and shot at least once. Officers returned fire, killing him.[31][32]

properties.name: Zepeda, Laura (41)
properties.description: Officer pursuing a stolen vehicle drove through a red light and collided with a vehicle not being pursued. The driver of the vehicle suffered severe head trauma and died on May 4, 2012.[25]

properties.name: Pineda, Mark (21)
properties.description: An off-duty police officer shot and killed a man who allegedly broke his kitchen window and entered his apartment. The officer shot the man in the head.[75][76]

properties.name: Jones, Marquise (23)
properties.description: Officer Robert Encina was working private duty (in full uniform) at a restaurant when he approached the drive-through because of an alleged disturbance between two vehicles. Jones was a passenger in one of the vehicles. Police say that Jones got out of the vehicle and displayed a gun, prompting Encina to shoot him multiple times in the torso. Witnesses and family contest this in a lawsuit, saying that Jones did not display a gun and was shot in the back as he tried to leave.[11][12]

properties.name: Redus, Robert Cameron (23)
properties.description: A man was pulled over for a traffic stop. The officer fired multiple shots at the man who was later pronounced dead at the scene.[7]

properties.name: Dunton, Anthony (45)
properties.description: Was shot and killed in hospital after swinging a chain and charging at deputies guarding him, police say. He was about to undergo a CT scan after an earlier incident in the downtown jail, where he was "subdued" by several deputies who used a Taser at least once after he allegedly attacked them.[89]

properties.name: Venable, Billye
properties.description: Shot in the head while allegedly resisting arrest.[75]

properties.name: Hernandez, Philip (40)
properties.description: Police began following a van that matched the description for several recent crimes. The driver allegedly stopped, got out of the van, and began shooting at officers with a rifle. The officers shot the man to death.[1]

properties.name: Alvarado, Alex (38)
properties.description: Officer Gabriel Garcia shot in the head during a "protracted gun battle," trainee returned fire and killed shooter [15]

properties.name: Salonga, Ryan
properties.description: Police shot and killed a stolen car suspect.[25]

properties.name: unnamed male (21)
properties.description: Officers attempted to stop a vehicle for speeding. A high speed pursuit ensued. After the suspect drove into a vacant lot, he U-turned and drove towards the officers. The officers opened fire, fatally wounding the driver and injuring a passenger.[33]

properties.name: DuBose, Demetrius
properties.description: Shot while charging at officers while waving their nunchukas. Officers attempted to question DuBose outside a home that had been burglarized. When DuBose fled officers caught him and they scuffled during which DuBose took nunchukas from two officers.[94]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Officers surrounded an apartment complex after receiving a report that two wanted parolees were there and at least one was armed. After several hours the men fled and one was cornered. One was fatally shot after refusing to show his hands and reaching into his pockets. The other suspect was arrested after an hours-long search.[25]

properties.name: Naecker, Fritz O. (63)
properties.description: Police responded to report of an armed man at a restaurant. The police arrived to find the man in the outdoor patio area of the restaurant "waving a silver handgun." Two officers fired at the man when he allegedly turned to enter the restaurant, killing him. Police were unsure if the gun was loaded.[109]

properties.name: Lopez-Gonzalez, Gabriel (22)
properties.description: Police shot and killed Lopez-Gonzalez who, according to media reports, had held his girlfriend hostage. Online cell phone footage shows police barrage.[43][44]

properties.name: Tovar, Adolpho Vargas (47)
properties.description: Tovar was fatally shot by officers after he drove a car in reverse towards them. He had allegedly robbed a nearby gas station.[15]

properties.name: Clore, Dennis Allen (54)
properties.description: Shot to death by officers after refusing to drop the baseball bat he was holding. Officers were responding to a domestic dispute.[101][102]

properties.name: Williams, Bartholomew (38)
properties.description: Officers responded to a report from dorm staff that a dorm tenant was acting irrationally. The officers determined that Williams was a threat to himself and others and attempted to arrest him. Williams resisted, using the officers' pepper spray on them, taking a baton from one and wrestled one to the ground and began kicking him in the head and torso. Two other officers then fatally shot Williams.[22]

properties.name: Williams, Tremayne Marshawn (27)
properties.description: Williams was shot and killed, and a woman accompanying him shot and wounded, during a police chase through two cities after officers attempted to pull over a stolen vehicle.[73][74]

properties.name: Kalyuzhnyy, Leonid (51)
properties.description: A man was shot and killed after allegedly firing a rifle at officers from an apartment window in the Capitol Hill neighborhood.[3][4]

properties.name: Love, Levon Leroy (44)
properties.description: Love was found passed out in his car and naked from the waist down, police said. Paramedics were called, but Love resisted efforts to load him into an ambulance and jumped back into his car instead, police said. He started to drive away with the gurney dragging behind him until he crashed into a pickup. Police said Love would not calm down as they tried to detain him after the crash, so they deployed Tasers.[32]

properties.name: Smith, Derrick (26)
properties.description: Police responded to report of suicidal man attempting to harm himself. Officers found the man bleeding from his arms. His wife had taken a knife away from the man. The man lunged at the officers with two screwdrivers. A Taser was deployed. When the man removed the prongs he was shot once and died.[64][65]

properties.name: Schuck, Daniel (47)
properties.description: Police were responding to a disturbance call at a hotel. Upon entering the room, the suspect allegedly fired at officers, both of whom returned fire. The suspect was pronounced dead at the scene.[50][51]

properties.name: Salinas, Charles
properties.description: Officers were responding to a report of an armed suicidal person. When they approached the home, Salinas fled and hid behind an Auto Zone. After refusing commands from officers, officers fired 30-40 rounds at Salinas, according to several witnesses. A Fresno County sheriff's official referred to this incident as a "police officer-assisted suicide."[49][50]

properties.name: Meija, Elias (27)
properties.description: Police were looking for Meija in connection with a homicide and spotted him in a stolen vehicle and blocked his car. Meija allegedly tried to ram his way out. San Jose officer Bruce Barthelemy shot and killed Meja after getting out of an unmarked police vehicle when Meja drove toward him.[5]

properties.name: Snowman, Diana (19)
properties.description: A woman was fatally shot by police after she pointed a cordless drill designed to appear as an Uzi firearm. The officer who shot Snowden, Wakana Okuma, was CIT trained. [37]

properties.name: Vasquez, Albert Manuel (42)
properties.description: A man who was suspected of stabbing and injuring three people inside a home fled in a van. As police tried to encountered him, the suspect tried to do a U-turn into the patrol car to hit the patrol car, and the cops started shooting at him. The suspect died.[6][7]

properties.name: Unidentified male
properties.description: A man took his ex-girlfriend hostage and led authorities on a high-speed overnight chase for 50 miles in a stolen police vehicle. When the suspect stopped during the chase, he barricaded himself and held the woman at gunpoint. He then pointed the handgun at SWAT officers. The SWAT officers opened fire on the suspect, killing him. The hostage suffered a minor injury to her leg.[5]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Officers on patrol attempted to speak to a suspicious person in the back seat of a car. The suspect jumped into the front seat and drove towards the officers who then fatally shot him.[36]

properties.name: Hughes, Dennis, 41
properties.description: Killed in his girlfriend's apartment by a police sharpshooter after beating his mother to death when she tried to evict him from her home in Ronhert Park. Hughes had fired several shots at officers from the apartment.[35]

properties.name: Tacadena, Brian (46)
properties.description: Officers confronted Tacadena, holding a knife, ordered him to drop it and he refused. They fired on him, killing him.[39]

properties.name: unname male (41)
properties.description: Officers responded to a report of a domestic disturbance. After being assured by a 41-year-old man and his 66-year-old father that the matter was settled, the officers left. Moments later they heard arguing and returned to find the son advancing on his father with a knife. The son refused commands to drop the knife and was fatally shot by all three officers.[37]

properties.name: Naharro-Gionet, Andrea (61)
properties.description: Police responded to disturbance call. They encountered a woman holding a knife. She refused to drop the knife and reportedly backed one of the deputies into a corner, whereupon the deputy fatally shot her. Family of Naharro-Gionet say she had multiple sclerosis and did not pose a threat.[27][28]

properties.name: Lee, Henry, Sr. (77)
properties.description: The man used a medical alert system to request help because of a suspicious activity in the area. When officers arrived at his house, he came outside with a gun. Two of the officers shot him when he allegedly raised the weapon towards them.[19]

properties.name: Aduddell, Ronald (28)
properties.description: Police attempted a traffic stop when they felt a vehicle looked suspicious, and a chase ensued. After reportedly ramming several police cars, Aduddell got out of the vehicle and was shot to death by Officers Ian Cooley and Adam Jenkins, who say his hands were on his waistband area. Police did not locate a weapon at the scene.[33]

properties.name: Goulet, Jeremy (35)
properties.description: Goulet was shot and killed during a police pursuit after allegedly fatally shooting Santa Cruz officers Sgt. Loran Baker and Detective Elizabeth Butler. Baker and Butler had come to Goulet's home to follow up on assault allegations.

properties.name: Rodriguez Jr., Jose (14)
properties.description: Rodriguez allegedly called 9-1-1 to report a man with a gun outside of his house. When officers arrived at the scene, they found Rodriguez standing by the road armed with a shotgun. Rodriguez ignored orders to drop the weapon. Officers fatally shot Rodriguez when he allegedly pointed the weapon at them.[9]

properties.name: Anaya, Jeanette (39)
properties.description: According to New Mexico State Police, Anaya was seen driving erratically, and fled when police attempted to pull her over at 1:15 AM. A 5-minute high-speed chase ensued, whereupon the police executed a pursuit intervention maneuver, causing her to crash into a residential wall. When the police officer approached Anaya, she "began to aggressively and immediately back towards the officer" in her vehicle, according to police statements. The officer opened fire, killing Anaya. A 34-year-old male passenger suffered minor injuries.[34][35][36][37][38]

properties.name: Ortega, Jose Luis (22)
properties.description: Ortega was shot to death by officers as he jumped out of his car and ran behind a truck. Police say Ortega was armed, a gang member, and a wanted parolee.[13]

properties.name: Covarrubias, Alberto, Jr. (29)
properties.description: Covarrubias, a Santa Maria police officer, was shot and killed by a fellow officer as supervisors struggled to arrest him for an alleged sexual relationship with a 17-year-old Police Explorer.[7]

properties.name: Reyes, Robert Padilla (37)
properties.description: Officers responding to a report of a man with a gun became involved in an hour-long high-speed pursuit with the suspect. After police used spike strips to disable the vehicle, the man allegedly stepped out with a gun. Officers shot the man to death.[119]

properties.name: Garcia, Edgar (25)
properties.description: Garcia was shot to death by officers after he allegedly shot and wounded an officer. Police say they had been called to the home twice that day over safety concerns.[16]

properties.name: Garcia-Jauregui, Jose Angel (27)
properties.description: Garcia-Jauregui allegedly shot and killed Sgt. Cory Wride when the officer stopped to check on a vehicle he thought was abandoned. Officers caught up with Garcia-Jauregui and exchanged gunfire with him. Garcia-Jauregui and another officer were both shot and hospitalized; Garcia-Jauregui died later of his injuries.

properties.name: Lopez, Andy (13)
properties.description: Deputies were responding to a report of a suspicious person when they spotted Lopez, a 13-year-old eighth-grader, carrying what they believed to be an assault rifle while walking through a vacant lot. After Lopez did not obey orders to drop the gun, deputy Erick Gelhaus fired eight rounds at him from 20 to 30 feet away. Lopez, who was actually carrying an airsoft replica of an AK-47 which fired plastic pellets, was struck seven times and died at the scene.[22][23][24] In July 2014, Sonoma County District Attorney Jill Ravitch decided not to file criminal charges against Gelhaus, claiming that the deputy fired at Lopez in self-defense and believed that the airsoft replica was a real firearm.

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: A Border Patrol agent encountered a group of people who had illegally crossed the border. A physical altercation occurred and the agent fatally shot one of the group.[36]

properties.name: Moretz, Chad
properties.description: Officers approached Moretz at his home to question him about a missing man who was a friend of his. A standoff ensued which ended when Moretz walked out of his house with a rifle in hand and was fatally shot by a SWAT sniper. The dismembered remains of the friend were found in the house.[35]

properties.name: Fender, Bruce
properties.description: Died from injuries after being struck by police cruiser. Witness report that Fender walked in front of the vehicle and was not using a designated crosswalk.[48]

properties.name: Smashum, Anthony
properties.description: Shot while climbing fence to escape from police. Officers approached Smashum attempting to arrest him on a warrant. Smashum fought with officers before fleeing.[33]

properties.name: Prostrollo, Jason Edward
properties.description: Prostrollo was shot to death by officers after holding pool cues in a threatening manner and approaching officers. Police had responded to a 911 call from a woman who said a man with a knife was fighting with her boyfriend.[5]

properties.name: Loxas, John
properties.description: Loxas was allegedly holding his baby grandson when an argument with neighbors led to him brandishing a handgun at them. They called the police. Officer James Peters shot Loxas in the head while he was still holding the baby. He was not holding a gun at the time.[16]

properties.name: Capano, John McGoey, James
properties.description: Capano, a special agent with the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, was shot in the chest by a retired officer while struggling with McGoey, who had just robbed a pharmacy where Capano was a customer. The officer had mistaken Capano for an armed assailant. McGoey was then shot and killed by an off-duty officer who came to the scene.[2][3]

properties.name: Crahay, Holly
properties.description: Shot after shooting at police. Officers were attempting to stop Crahay for reckless driving. Crahay led officers on chase who performed PIT maneuver causing Crahay's vehicle to spin to a stop at which point she began shooting.[24]

properties.name: Leday, Albert, Jr.
properties.description: Unarmed man shot three times by a deputy after high-speed chase with deputies.[60]

properties.name: Duckworth, Martin A. (31)
properties.description: Martin A. Duckworth barged onto a bus and shot the driver five times in downtown Seattle. Duckworth then ran on foot and entered another bus, where he was followed by several police officers. Duckworth aimed his gun at officers, which led the officers to shoot the gunman at least a dozen times, fatally wounding him. Two officers were injured and several passengers on the bus were superficially injured from flying glass.[19][20]

properties.name: Sullivan, Robert
properties.description: Shot after shooting at and injuring one officer. Police had confronted Sullivan when they saw him shooting at someone else.[41]

properties.name: Ariel Rosenfeld
properties.description: Shot after man pulled gun from his waistband during fight with police. Officers were at man's place of employment to arrest him for investigation of domestic violence the night before.[43]

properties.name: Smith, Russell (51)
properties.description: Members of the Bellevue Police Department SWAT team were serving a warrant at a Seattle home for the arrest of suspects in a series of robberies in Bellevue.[3][4]

properties.name: Joel Reuter (28)
properties.description: A man fired a pistol at Seattle SWAT team officers. The SWAT team members responded with gunfire, fatally hitting the man.[17][18]

properties.name: Humphries, Donald Michael
properties.description: Shot while approaching officer and pulling out a .45 caliber handgun. Officer was attempting to pull over Humphries for erratic driving. After a chase, Humphries got out of his car and approached officer.[85]

properties.name: Ballou, Michael W.
properties.description: Shot after failing to follow commands to surrender.[59]

properties.name: Nager, Ross
properties.description: Shot after exiting vehicle with shotgun or rifle in hand. Police were responding to report that Nager was making threats to people inside a home and firing his weapon. After SWAT team arrive Nager attempted to leave in a vehicle but was blocked.[127]

properties.name: Humphrey, Jesse (30)
properties.description: Police had a warrant to search the house. Jesse Humphrey made a shot from a long rifle, which led to the arrival of a SWAT team who killed the man.

properties.name: unnamed male (20)
properties.description: Police approached a man that neighbors reported was acting “peculiar” by running around and hitting his head on signs. The suspect became violent and combative, prompting an officer to fatally shoot him once in the chest.[63]

properties.name: Palmer, Aaron (24)
properties.description: An officer was at the Palmer's home serving a felony warrant against Palmer's father, Randall Palmer. The younger Palmer allegedly confronted the officer with a knife. The officer fired once, striking him in the chest. Palmer died later at the hospital.[24]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: An off-duty officer was woken in his home by the sounds of a break-in. He fatally shot the intruder.[29]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Shot in vehicle while being questioned by police. Officers were responding to report of man knocking at front and back doors of a house.[51]

properties.name: Albrecht, David
properties.description: Shot after refusing to drop knife and shotgun. Police were responding to report of suicidal person.[77]

properties.name: Arraiol, David (34)
properties.description: Officers approached Arraiol on foot regarding outstanding warrants. When Arraiol drew a handgun officers fatally shot him.[49]

properties.name: Arnold, Eugene Leroy, Jr. (36)
properties.description: Arnold fled from police in Oklahoma and crossed into Texas. The vehicle chase ended when Arnold crashed into a field. A struggle ensued between Arnold and a Texas DPS officer. During the struggle, Arnold was fatally wounded by a gunshot.[1]

properties.name: Evans, Eric Blaine
properties.description: Shot after physically attacking a police detective. The officer was tracking Evans as a prime suspect in a recent stabbing murder.[34]

properties.name: Derby, Austin (36)
properties.description: Derby was involved in a high-speed chase with police and crashed his truck near Interstate 5. Derby then ran away into a shed, where police confronted him later. Derby then came out of the shed and pointed at them with a pellet gun designed to look realistic. The officers fatally shot Derby.[21]

properties.name: Anderson, James D (32)
properties.description: Subject was ejected from a club, after which he returned and shot two people, including his girlfriend. When responding officers contacted him as he was leaving, shots were exchanged and subject was killed.[7][8]

properties.name: Brewer, Kent (19)
properties.description: Brewer was shot to death in the chest by officers after he allegedly refused to drop the sword he was "wielding." Officers were responding to a call about a family fight in the apartment. Brewer was pronounced dead on the scene.[105]

properties.name: Bailey, DeEric (22)
properties.description: Police attempted to pull over a car for traffic violations. The driver attempted to flee but ended up wrecking the car. The passengers exited the vehicle, but the driver attempted to flee again. Officers fired into the car, fatally wounding the driver.[49][50]

properties.name: Haggerty, Elijah (31)
properties.description: Officers were responding to a shooting and found a woman with gunshot wounds outside a home. In the home, they found Haggerty, who allegedly pointed a shotgun at the officers. Two officers fired at the man, killing him.[100]

properties.name: King, Marie (55) Boren, Kelly (32) Boren, Joshua (7) Boren, Haley (5)
properties.description: Lindon police officer Joshua Boren (34) did not show up for work one night, prompting his commander to send officers to his home where they found the bodies of Boren's mother-in-law, wife, and two children, along with his own body. Police say the couple had been experiencing marital problems for several months.

properties.name: Netter, Matthew (23)
properties.description: Netter was shot 8 times point blank range (7 shots in his back) killed by a Poulsbo Washington Police Officer Darrell Moore within 6 minutes of a routine traffic stop Netter merely had questioned the officer why he was being searched. Netter was unarmed and still buckled in his seat belt when he was killed. False reports stated Netter was armed had an altercation with the officer and had pointed a weapon at the officer. Dash Cam Video contradicts all of those reported as fact - and other false media and city reports. Death Ruled Homicide. Justified by the Prosecuting Attorney.

properties.name: Woodfork, Tracy Jr. (22)
properties.description: Police responded to report of possibly suicidal man. Police found a man with gun in hand. A confrontation ensued and the man was shot by police. He died at a local hospital. Investigators determined that firearm in his possession was a replica.[38]

properties.name: Bayer, Stephen
properties.description: A man described as depressed over business reversals led authorities on a three-county auto chase that ended Monday morning, when police fatally shot him after he pointed a loaded handgun at them, authorities said. [99] [100] [101]

properties.name: Costa, Devon (21)
properties.description: Costa was shot after punching an officer in the face and reaching for her gun.[27]

properties.name: Sambuunyam, Erdenebileg (40)
properties.description: Police went to a domestic disturbance incident and attempted to restrain Sambuunyam, who had attacked and injured two people. Sambuunyam tried to cut the officers with a knife and was subsequently shot. He was transported to a hospital and passed away from his gunshot wounds.[12]

properties.name: Wiggins, Darryl C. (47)
properties.description: Officers responded to a report of shots fired and found Wiggins in front of a house with another man who appeared to have been assaulted. Officers shot Wiggins to death after he allegedly refused commands to drop a handgun.[74]

properties.name: Sargent, Willie Allen Jr
properties.description: Died of injuries from motor vehicle accidents. Sargent's vehicle was hit by an officer responding to a call for backup for a suspicious person. The officer was traveling approximately 80 mph without lights or siren.[45]

properties.name: Rivera, David Dale (52)
properties.description: Officers responded to a report of a man threatening to kill his one-year-old son, his girlfriend and himself. When officers arrived, he lunged towards them with a knife in each hand. An officer shot Rivera who died at a local hospital.[42]

properties.name: Collins, Harold Joseph (64)
properties.description: Collins entered a police department lobby and pointed a handgun at an officer without saying anything. Officers ordered Collins to drop the weapon. When he did not, gunfire was exchanged, injuring one officer and killing Collins.[23]

properties.name: Pogue, Daniel
properties.description: Shot after ignoring order to stop running, threatening bystanders, and drop his weapon. Pogue was armed with "two shotguns, a rifle, several swords, and a machete."[3]

properties.name: Taylor, Dillon
properties.description: Taylor was unarmed and walking out of a convenience store. Police had been called to the scene due to an anonymous report and ended up shooting Taylor in the parking lot.[52]

properties.name: Potts, Martin Y.
properties.description: Police were investigating two burglaries and attempting to execute a search warrant on a property when they encountered Potts, who fled. Potts was killed by members of a Special Response Team after allegedly firing at officers.

properties.name: Gilyard, Michael
properties.description: Shot during struggle with officer after Gilyard reached for the officer's handgun. The officer had stopped Gilyard as he was leaving an area where there had been reports of narcotics activity. The coroner's report indicates that the cause of death was a single gunshot wound to the chest with a trajectory from back to front.[7]

properties.name: Lauro Avechuco (40)
properties.description: Officer Justin Dannels stopped Avechuco for speeding. After stopping briefly, Avechuco fled into a nearby neighborhood and stopped again in the 3900 block of Mahonia Place. At this point, police say, Avechuco accelerated his vehicle toward Dannels, who fired his sidearm several times, killing Avechuco.[2]

properties.name: Dakota Bright (15)
properties.description: A 15-year-old who allegedly pointed a gun at officers was shot in the head by police in the South Side’s Greater Grand Crossing neighborhood, authorities said. Officers said they saw Dakota Bright with a handgun The police state that officers approached, Dakota fled on foot, the officers chased him. During the pursuit, the officers shot Dakota. A weapon was recovered at the scene, police said. Bright, of the 7600 block of South Emerald, was declared dead on the scene at 4:11 p.m., according to the Cook County medical examiner’s office. Officials at the morgue said Saturday that the cause of death was a gunshot wound to the head, and they could not provide further details.[25]

properties.name: Marquez, Samuel Jason (44)
properties.description: Police were called when Marquez arrived at his mother's house and began arguing with her. She had a restraining order against him. Police say that when officers arrived, Marquez walked outside with a knife to his mother's throat. Officers shot and killed Marquez when he allegedly turned back toward the house and tried to take her with him.[33]

properties.name: Hull, John M.
properties.description: Officers spotted a pickup truck doing doughnuts and ran the plates, discovering that the vehicle was reported stolen. When they tried to conduct a traffic stop, the truck drove around the block, through a yard, and allegedly hit the patrol car head on. Hull then backed up and hit the car again, police say, and the officers got out and fired at him, killing him.[66]

properties.name: Creach, Wayne Scott
properties.description: Shot with handgun in back waistband after approaching unmarked police car in parking lot of Creach's business around 11 pm. The family reported the Creach thought he had heard a burglar and had gone outside to investigate.[41]

properties.name: Dorfman, Jacob (52)
properties.description: An eyewitness claimed he saw a shirtless man pacing in the street and screaming for help before firing one shot from a handgun. After a short car chase, officers shot and killed Mr. Dorfman.[18]

properties.name: Ambrose, Kevin
properties.description: Mitchell reported that off-duty prison guard Shawn Bryan was near her apartment in violation of a restraining order. Officer Kevin Ambrose responded to the call and attempted to force entry to the apartment into which Bryan had taken Mitchell. Bryan shot Ambrose through the door, shot Mitchell, then shot himself. Ambrose and Bryan died of their wounds.[69]

properties.name: Edwards, Wayne (23)
properties.description: Edwards was fatally wounded by a Massachusetts State Police trooper during an altercation. After the officer approached Edwards's vehicle at a traffic stop, Edwards reportedly became combative. Police began firing. Edwards then attempted to flee and crashed his vehicle. He was brought to Baystate Medical Center, where he died. A female passenger in the vehicle was treated for minor injuries and released the same night.[22][23]

properties.name: Curler, John A
properties.description: Died from injuries after being struck by police cruiser. Curler was cross an intersection on foot as the officer was responding to a “trouble unknown” report with lights and siren off.[170][171]

properties.name: Parker, Christopher J. (33)
properties.description: Mr. Parker called 911 to report he was diabetic and had ingested methamphetamine. Responding police arrested him on an outstanding warrant, and while in the county jail deputies used a Taser on him when he allegedly became uncooperative.

properties.name: Dodd, Quentin
properties.description: Shot after charging at deputies with obsidian knife in hand and after yelling “Shoot me.” at officers. Officers were responding to report that Dodd was threatening roommate with knife.[23]

properties.name: Groom, Jeremy
properties.description: Shot after refusing command to drop weapon. Groom was in a shooter's stance and pointing a handgun at another man's head.[12]

properties.name: Corporon, Ethan
properties.description: Shot after firing shotgun at police and in the air. Police were responding to report of man firing shotgun at a house.[17]

properties.name: White, Todd Ely
properties.description: Shot after firing four times at officers. Police were responding to report of a man carrying gun in neighborhood.[23][72]

properties.name: Dennis, Kenneth
properties.description: Shot during investigation of report of domestic violence. Police report Dennis was armed with a knife.[179]

properties.name: Gover, Edward S. (47)
properties.description: Gover was shot 6 times by officers who confronted him in his girlfriend's backyard, believing him to be armed. Gover allegedly told the officers he had a knife, but only a set of keys was found by his body. Police had begun pursuing him after receiving a domestic assault report.[69][70]

properties.name: Rogers, James
properties.description: Shot after two-hour standoff with police and pointing shotgun at police. Police were responding to report of suicidal man.[52]

properties.name: Combs, Gray Alan Jr (22)
properties.description: Police responded to a report of a wanted person. They found Combs hiding in a bedroom. Combs threatened officers with a sword and refused to comply with their demands. Officers opened fired with both beanbag ammunition and live rounds. Combs died at a local hospital.[17][18]

properties.name: Greer, John (46)
properties.description: After police responded to a call of a domestic dispute at a house in Springfield, an officer fired a shot at John Greer, killing him. Greer was reported to be armed with a firearm. The case is being investigated.[3]

properties.name: Newsom, Evan F. (17)
properties.description: While investigating a single vehicle crash and abandoned vehicle, officers approached Newsom at a home where he allegedly attacked a deputy with a knife. Officers opened fire and killed him. The deputy who was allegedly attacked suffered superficial wounds.[49]

properties.name: Eric Garner (43)
properties.description: Garner had just broken up a fight between several other men when he was approached by two plainclothes police officers who questioned him about illegal cigarette sales. Garner got angry and the officers proceeded to arrest him. He resisted arrest and the officers placed him in a chokehold and slammed his head against the ground. Three more officers showed up and joined in the fight. Garner began shouting "I can't breathe" which he did six times before dying. The chokehold tactic is prohibited to be used by NYPD officers. On August 1, 2014, the New York City Medical Examiner's Office ruled Garner's death to be a homicide.[12]

properties.name: Pryor, George (61)
properties.description: Police were at Pryor's home dealing with a code enforcement issue. A confrontation ensued and Pryor was killed.[2]

properties.name: Ahmed, Fuaed Abdo (20)
properties.description: Fuaed Abdo Ahmed took three bank employees hostage inside a bank for several hours. Ahmed released one hostage and, hours later, shot two of the hostages; one died, and the other was injured. Police then shot and killed Ahmed.[17]

properties.name: Brischetto, Damon (29)
properties.description: "An officer spotted Brischetto speeding early on Feb. 27 ... The car had crashed into a guardrail and burst into flames. Police could see two women inside the car and wanted to help get them out. As officers tried to find a fire extinguisher, a Woodson Terrace officer saw a man inside the burning car holding a gun, police say. Brischetto fired shots, and the officers returned fire. The two women survived the crash. One of the women got out on her own. Police pulled the other woman to safety from the back seat. She suffered severe burns. Neither woman is being charged with any crime in connection to the incident. Police have not identified either woman. [10]

properties.name: Holt-Singh, Misty (41), Renteria Jr. Gilbert (30) Martinez, Alex Gregory (27)
properties.description: Two bank robbers were shot and killed by police during an exchange of gunfire during a high-speed chase, and their hostage, 41-year-old Misty Holt-Singh, was killed by police gunfire. Holt-Singh was abducted by the bank robbers at gunpoint and forced into a stolen SUV, A third bank robber, 19-year-old Jaime Ramos, survived. Ramos was charged with murder in connection with the shooting.[13][14][15]

properties.name: Heeter, Richard
properties.description: Police were responding to a report of shots fired at a home when Heeter allegedly shot two of the responding officers and then fled. A SWAT team was called and Heeter was found, but refused commands to lay down on the ground and allegedly stabbed a SWAT officer. Other officers opened fire, killing him.[27]

properties.name: Powell, Kajieme (25)
properties.description: A 25-year-old man with a knife was shot by two officers. The man was reported saying that he wanted to die; family report he was "mentally challenged". The shooting took place three miles away from the site of the shooting of Michael Brown in Ferguson, and occurred during Ferguson unrest.[26]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: After reports of a man wielding a heavy duty semi-automatic pistol were made, police arrived on the scene. The man was killed during a shootout with police officers.[14]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Shot after shooting at police. The suspect had stolen a motorcycle at gunpoint, crashed it and ran into nearby woods pursued by officers.[3]

properties.name: Anderson, Willie (54)
properties.description: Shot by officers after allegedly advancing on them with a machete.[5]

properties.name: Nash, Antonio (18)
properties.description: Nash was shot and killed by an off-duty police officer during an attempted robbery.[12]

properties.name: Pollard, Myron (18)
properties.description: Pollard was shot by an ATF agent and died the following morning. The ATF and local police were attempting to arrest Pollard and four others following a multi-week investigation.[7]

properties.name: Jones, Brandon (23)
properties.description: Officers were responding to a home burglary by three individuals when two of them began shooting at police. In their return fire officers shot Jones to death, while the other two suspects fled and were captured. A SWAT team was also present.[77][78]

properties.name: Yancey, Linda Cax-Puluc, Marcial
properties.description: Shot by a Sheriff's deputy who staged a murder-robbery of his wife and claimed to have killed the robber. Instead, the deputy was himself found guilty of murdering both his wife Yancey and the day laborer Cax-Puluc.[16][17]

properties.name: Kenney, Christopher (23)
properties.description: Kenney was shot in a stolen pick-up truck after being cornered by 10 officers who blocked him in using their vehicles. Officers broke the truck window and tased Kenny multiple times as he rammed his truck into the squad cars, and then was shot by officers. Kenney had several outstanding warrants and was a primary suspect in several vehicle theft cases.[13]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Shot after firing several times at police officers, injuring one. SWAT team responded to report of domestic violence that included one gunshot wound.[84]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Officers stopped a car as part of a drug investigation regarding a long-time drug dealer. The suspect began driving back and forth, ramming to police cruisers who had blocked his vehicle. Officers opened fire, killing the driver. Two passengers were unharmed.[19]

properties.name: Vang, Yee (20)
properties.description: A carjacking suspect shot at police officers, and officers returned fire, killing the suspect.[79]

properties.name: Kerr, Jason (31)
properties.description: Police shot and killed a 31-year-old man.[31]

properties.name: Sexton, Ronald (23)
properties.description: Officers were called to the home of Sexton about an argument with his neighbor. When they arrived they say he answered the door holding a gun. He was fatally shot on his porch.[38]

properties.name: Cooley, Lelann (46)
properties.description: Cooley was shot at his home when he pointed a rifle at police responding to a noise complaint.[28]

properties.name: Ararao, Bernardo D.
properties.description: Killed in a senior center after showing a gun a woman there and telling her he was "going on assignment." Officers shot the 55-year-old man to death when he refused to drop his weapon.[105]

properties.name: Blocker, Mark Anthony (20)
properties.description: Officers were responding to reports of two men arguing, one with a gun. Cpl. Vincent Tabbs and Officer Andrew Nacin shot and killed Blocker when he refused their orders to drop the weapon, which was discovered to be a pellet gun.[7]

properties.name: Taylor, Devin (24)
properties.description: An officer stopped Taylor for speeding. The officer attempted to arrest Taylor for driving while intoxicated but Taylor resisted. After use of a Taser was ineffective, the officer fatally shot Taylor.[64]

properties.name: Campuzano, Jose Carlos
properties.description: Shot after pulling out a gun and shooting at officers. Police has pulled over a vehicle containing three people, including Campuzano, as suspects in a recent nearby shooting.[136]

properties.name: Glen Griggs (53)
properties.description: Sunnyvale police intended to confront Griggs regarding the disappearance of his roommate and the possible connection to three other women he had know and who had died under unusual circumstances. He brandished a BB gun and officers killed him.[35] [36]

properties.name: Nehez, Michael (68)
properties.description: Michael Nehez stabbed his 55-year-old wife to death and then called 911. As police officers surrounded his house, Nehez ran towards them and charged at them with a knife. The officers fired at Nehez, killing him.[26][27][28]

properties.name: Saeteurn, Saan Pao (32)
properties.description: Saan Pao Saeteurn was shot and killed by police after brandishing a pellet gun at them. The pellet gun was designed to look like an authentic rifle.[33]

properties.name: Sprankle, Kenneth (27)
properties.description: Sprankle had a history of mental illness. He was shot by police after chasing people with an ax.[10]

properties.name: Lacy Jr., Hydra
properties.description: Shot after fatally shooting two police officers, Thomas John "Tom" Baitinger and Jeffrey Adam Yaslowitz, who were serving an arrest warrant for aggravated battery and two other felony charges.[174]

properties.name: Fleming, Harold (40)
properties.description: Fleming, a quadriplegic, was crossing a street in a wheelchair around 4 a.m. when he was struck by Officer Mehmedin Karic's speeding cruiser. Fleming was killed by the accident, and Karic was cited for careless driving (three months later). On August 2, 2012, Karic was fired for violating traffic laws and driving carelessly.[8][9]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: A man walked into an emergency room of A Bay Pines VA Medical Center and reportedly waved a knife around, which prompted Veterans Affairs police officers to shoot him.[15]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Two undercover officers came across a burglary-in-progress and shot and killed a male suspect who allegedly pointed a gun at them.[38]

properties.name: Black, Thomas Anthony
properties.description: Officers were serving an arrest warrant when they shot 44-year-old Black to death. Police retracted their original statement that Black had shot at officers after no handgun was recovered at the scene and no evidence supported Black's firing at them. Detectives said they did find a toy gun in the vicinity.[14]

properties.name: Welling, Austin
properties.description: 18-year-old Welling was shot and critically injured after an officer pulled him over on suspicion of driving a stolen vehicle. Welling allegedly put the car in reverse and drove toward the officer, who fired at him several times. The 18-year-old was taken off of life support on January 31, 2012.[19]

properties.name: Sim, Sambo (42)
properties.description: Shot by police responding to a domestic violence call after Mr. Sim allegedly fired several rounds at police.[83]

properties.name: Gavin, Prince Jamel (29)
properties.description: Officers were responding to a domestic violence call, and when they arrived Gavin got out of a truck and ran towards the house. At some point he turned, causing an officer to feel threatened, shooting him to death. Investigators allegedly found a gun near Gavin's body. This incident is that officer's second shooting in his 5-year career.[3]

properties.name: Waits, Jed
properties.description: Shot after shooting at deputy. Officers had pulled over Waits' vehicle as the prime suspect in a recent murder.[79]

properties.name: O'Connell, Robert David
properties.description: Shot after shooting three times at police. Officers were approaching man for acting suspiciously at a gas station.[173]

properties.name: Sims, Richard Wayne
properties.description: Shot after refusing commands to put down knife and then raising knife in an overhand threatening manner. Police were responding to a report of a man waving a knife around in front of a bus stop.[34]

properties.name: Moore, Rodney (35)
properties.description: An officer responded to a call from Moore's wife that Moore was hearing voices and afraid someone was going to hurt him. The first officer to arrive called for backup to use a Taser on Moore so he would drop the knife he was holding. When the second officer arrived, Moore turned toward that officer and was shot twice in the chest. The officer claims Moore advanced towards him. Moore's wife claims Moore held the knife pointing down and merely turned toward the officer.[8]

properties.name: Paulino, Jose, Jr. (38)
properties.description: Paulino was "Running around, yelling obscenities, and the employee of the market and a bystander called 911." Paulino was unarmed, but he wouldn't comply with officers, so they stunned with several times with a taser gun, according to State Police.[59]

properties.name: Rodgers, Steven Duane (34)
properties.description: Rodgers was walking across a street when he was struck and killed by a police cruiser. The cruiser, which had its lights and sirens on, was responding to a call about a fight involving a weapon.[40]

properties.name: Neal, Jevon (16)
properties.description: Neal was shot to death by officers at a party after allegedly pointing an assault-style shotgun at them. Police had arrived on the scene about an hour earlier in response to a report of someone shooting a weapon. They had identified Neal and approached the teen, who reportedly ran upstairs and pulled out a gun.[39]

properties.name: Westcott, Jason (29)
properties.description: Several police officers, executing a drug warrant, shot and killed Westcott when he raised a pistol against them, possibly thinking he was fending off robbers. Undercover offficers had observed Westcott, dead, of dealing drugs while armed. At the time of his death, Westcott had only $2 worth of marijuana in his possession.[13]

properties.name: Bates, Charlie (24)
properties.description: Bates was the suspect in multiple home invasions and sexual assaults. He was fatally shot during a shootout following a car chase.[32]

properties.name: Wickham, Kenneth
properties.description: Shot after refusing to stop waving gun after numerous police orders to do so. Police were responding to a report that Wickham was threatening to kill himself.[18]

properties.name: Galmon, Cjavar (18)
properties.description: Shot and killed by officers after they broke up a large fight at a nearby club.[82]

properties.name: Gary, Robert (31)
properties.description: Gary was shot by undercover officers buying crack cocaine.[40]

properties.name: Papineau, Brooks
properties.description: Shot during a traffic stop. Police say he pointed a gun at the officer.[111]

properties.name: Westby, Aaron
properties.description: Shot after reaching for gun in glove box after resisting arrest. Police had approached Westby regarding the stolen pickup he was inside.[35]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Shot after pointing gun at officers. Police were responding to report of domestic violence. During 6-hour standoff with SWAT team man threatened to shoot officers and himself.[22]

properties.name: Multanen, Monty Edward Multanen, Sue
properties.description: Shot by off-duty deputy Allen Myron who then killed himself.[64]

properties.name: Howell, John Wayne (57)
properties.description: About 5 p.m. on October 31, three deputies responded to a 911 call from residents on Old Wire Road who said a man, later identified as John Wayne Howell, was acting “erratically” and was threatening people with a machete. When deputies arrived, they tried to get Howell to drop the machete and a fight ensued while trying to get him under control. Howell advanced on one deputy, who tripped while trying to back away. When the officer went down, Howell raised the machete and swung, but missed. Then the other two deputies both fatally shot Howell. [1]

properties.name: Wheelihan, John (43)
properties.description: 43-year-old John Wheelihan walked out the back door of a house with a .22 caliber air rifle and approached detectives with it. After officers demanded Wheelihan to drop his weapon down multiple times, Wheelihan raised the rifle. The officers then fatally shot Wheelihan.[11]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: A man drove unto a sidewalk and struck a pedestrian, then struck at least two other vehicles. Officers on the scene shot at the vehicle, flattening its tires. The man fled on foot, then threatened to shoot an officer. That officer shot the man twice, who was pronounced dead at a local hospital.[29]

properties.name: Robards, Larry Wayne (54)
properties.description: Robards had taken several hospital staff as hostages in the emergency room. Police had started negotiations when a hostage attempted to grab Robards' gun. An officer shot Robards to end the struggle.[42][43]

properties.name: Graham, Ramarley (18)
properties.description: Shot once in upper left chest after being chased into his home by plainclothes officers. The unarmed Graham was running into the bathroom to flush marijuana down the toilet.[26]

properties.name: Stowell Jr., Gerald Arthur (50)
properties.description: Police were at the house after a reported rape occurred. After some officers left the house to take the victim to the hospital, the suspect entered a bathroom and allegedly came out with a large knife. Two officers shot him after he refused to drop the weapon.[40][41]

properties.name: Mason, Macadam (39)
properties.description: Officers responded to a call placed by Mason wherein he threatened to harm himself or others. Mason was hit by a Taser and suffered a cardiac arrest.[34]

properties.name: Carnes, Bryan Keith (44)
properties.description: An officer attempted to stop a suspect for a traffic violation. Suspect did not stop and led officer on a chase. Officers placed spikes on roadway and three of suspect's tires were deflated. Suspect's vehicle crashed. As officers approached vehicle, suspect reportedly yelled “Shoot me” and reached under his seat. An officer fired at least three shots. Suspect was taken to hospital where he died.[17]

properties.name: Muntz, Scott William (41)
properties.description: Officers arrived at Muntz's house after getting reports of shots being fired. Muntz fired at officers from inside the house. Muntz eventually exited the house armed with a pistol. He was shot by police aftering failing to follow orders to drop the weapon. Muntz died the following day of his injuries.[27]

properties.name: Riley, Dennis (38)
properties.description: A man was shot and killed by officers responding to reports of him assaulting a woman and pointing a gun at someone in their car.[86][87]

properties.name: Maldonado, Wesley (35)
properties.description: Maldonado was shot and killed after he led police on a high speed chase which ended in a Thornton apartment complex. Some witnesses to the shooting allege that police use of force was "excessive". Police allegedly found a firearm in the vehicle, after the pursuit, that had recently been fired.

properties.name: O'Meara, Patrick (28)
properties.description: Mr O'Meara was shot to death by Lakewood, WA police after allegedly pulling a gun, ignoring police commands, and making a move the officers found threatening.[2]

properties.name: Unnamed male
properties.description: According to police, the suspect walked towards officers, and officers shot at him with a stun gun. The suspect then took out a firearm from his waistband and pointed it towards officers. The man was then shot and killed by police.[25]

properties.name: Escribano, Frank (78)
properties.description: An officer responded to a report of an armed man on the highway. Escribano “charged at the trooper armed with a knife.” The officer initially retreated, but eventually felt the needed to shoot him. Escribano was pronounced dead at a local hospital. [71]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: As police attempted to serve a warrant in a domestic violence investigation in a home, a man shot and wounded two police detectives. The officers returned fire and killed the suspect.[11]

properties.name: Henry Jr., Danroy Thomas
properties.description: Innocent and Unarmed. Henry was shot three times and killed by police in the midst of a brawl outside Finnegan's Grill in the shopping center after striking an officer with his car.[27][28]

properties.name: Torres, Joe Campos
properties.description: Joe Campos Torres

properties.name: Swiney, Matthew Deshune (22)
properties.description: Swiney was fatally shot by police after holding a large knife dragging his mother down the hallway. His mother was treated at a hospital for stab wounds.[19]

properties.name: Alvarez, Vincent
properties.description: Police were called about a man assaulting someone with a baseball bat. When they arrived, officers said Alvarez approached them aggressively with "a large edged weapon" and they shot him to death.[108]

properties.name: Castillo-Romero, Johnny (23)
properties.description: An officer responding to a call about a man with a gun spotted Romero, and ordered him to show his hands. Romero, who was in a wheelchair, allegedly turned and pointed a weapon at the officer, who then fatally shot him.[46]

properties.name: Doll, Phillip Steven
properties.description: Doll was a "person of interest" in the murder of his girlfriend. He was shot and killed by a police officer responding to a home invasion. The officer found Doll crouched over an elderly victim, Doll then lunged at the officer.[12]

properties.name: Hughes, Gregory Martinez (22)
properties.description: Officers were responding to a report of shots fired at an apartment complex and an officer shot and killed Hughes.[14]

properties.name: Nazar, William
properties.description: Police were responding to a report of an armed suicidal man when Nazar allegedly walked out of his home shooting at officers. Deputy Steve Gerhardt returned fire, killing him.[106]

properties.name: Sanchez, Manuel
properties.description: Shot to death after pointing a gun at officers, who were pursuing him as a suspect in several armed robberies.[54]

properties.name: Sutton, Bobby Dale
properties.description: Shot after attacking officers with a knife.[43]

properties.name: Hallett, Donald (44)
properties.description: Hallett was shot and killed when a Tulsa Fugitive Task Force attempted to serve an arrest warrant. It was reported that Hallett met the officers with a shotgun and failed to comply with the officers orders.[6]

properties.name: Lake, Jeremy (19)
properties.description: Jeremy Lake was allegedly shot by his girlfriend's father, Tulsa police officer Shannon Kepler, in front of Lake's home. Kepler, who was off-duty at the time of the shooting, turned himself in to authorities afterwards. Kepler was booked on a charge of first-degree murder, and his wife was booked on a charge of accessory to murder. On August 19, the district's attorney formally charged Kepler with one count of first-degree murder and one count of shooting with intent to kill, for allegedly firing at his daughter. Wife Gina Kepler was arrested as accessory on about August 7.[67][68]

properties.name: Hunter, Aaron (19)
properties.description: Hunter was shot to death by an officer after reaching for a gun that he had dropped while attempting to flee officers.[7]

properties.name: Lopez, Robert (33)
properties.description: Lopez was hiding in a doghouse in the backyard of a woman's residence. The police officers attended the scene, saw the he was armed with a handgun, and opened fire.[7]

properties.name: Alvarez, Armando (44)
properties.description: Alvarez tried to get away on a bike after robbing the Chase Bank near Broadway and Wilmot. He was found nearby, hiding in a homeowner's shed. When he came out, officers noticed he had an object in his hand and refused to drop it, according to a news release. All three officers shot at Alvarez and he was later pronounced dead. [9]

properties.name: Davis, Willie Jr (23)
properties.description: An officer responded to a report of an armed robbery. A suspect matching the description was chased in a vehicle until the suspect crashed. An altercation ensued during which the officer fatally shot the suspect.[12][13]

properties.name: Guerena, Jose
properties.description: Shot by SWAT team conducting forced-entry search of home involving a drug probe. See Jose Guerena shooting.

properties.name: Witham, Renee (24)
properties.description: Witham was suicidal and called 911 to report that she was going to kill herself. The police officers attended the scene and found her outside with a man. They reported she took a gun out of a holster, and the police officers told her to drop the weapon. After she refused police officers opened fire, killing her and injuring the man.[7]

properties.name: Hiatt, Brian Scott (49)
properties.description: Two sheriff's deputies shot and killed Hiatt during a confrontation. Hiatt was a suspect in an incident the previous day in which two women were shot and killed.[2]

properties.name: Fuentes, Victor (22)
properties.description: Officers responded to reports of numerous gunshots at a home on New Year's Eve. Officers arrived and heard more gunshots. A man was seen with a weapon and commanded to drop it. He instead went inside the house. After again refusing commands to drop the weapon, Fuentes pointed the handgun at an officer who fatally shot him.[50]

properties.name: Lopez, Timothy (47)
properties.description: Police shot and killed a man wielding a pipe.[26]

properties.name: Worrell, Vergel Ricafrente (46)
properties.description: A man reportedly fired 10 to 15 gunshots in a neighborhood in Union City. The gunman refused to comply with the officers' demand and was then shot.[1][2]

properties.name: Waiters, Ariston
properties.description: Shot during a physical altercation with police. Officers were responding to a report of a fight between teenage girls and young adults. Neighbors report that the man was not involved in the fight and when shot, the man was running from police to avoid arrest on outstanding warrants. Autopsy confirmed Waiters was shot in the back.[8][9][10]

properties.name: Williams, Robyn (21)
properties.description: An off-duty officer rear-ended another vehicle, causing the other vehicle to burst into flames and killing the occupant. The officer failed a subsequent sobriety test, was taken into custody and charged with DUI.[21]

properties.name: Walker, Kendall (24)
properties.description: Walker was shot after he got out of his car and charged towards officers with a hammer and a knife.[13]

properties.name: Moreno, Gustavo Pedro (57)
properties.description: Moreno was shot to death by an officer after threatening him with a knife. Moreno was displaying irrational behavior and had come to the station to request a meeting with officers.[97][98]

properties.name: McKinnon, Derek
properties.description: Shot after refusing to drop weapon while holding a hostage. Police were monitoring a home for a murder suspect for whom warrants had been issued. The person fled the house to another and took a woman hostage.[87][88]

properties.name: Jarreau, Guy
properties.description: Shot to death in an alley by Officer Kent Tribble after flashing a revolver at the officer. Police were responding to a report of a man with a gun.[8]

properties.name: Moore, Jeremiah (29)
properties.description: Officers responded to a report of two naked men arguing, breaking car windows and attempting to set their own house on fire. Officers fatally shot Moore when he pointed a rifle at an officer.[21]

properties.name: Barrett, Anton (41)
properties.description: Barrett was shot to death by officers after they tried to pull over his car and had to chase him on foot. He was reaching for what turned out to be a metal wallet.[5]

properties.name: Romero, Mario (23)
properties.description: Romero and his brother-in-law, Joseph Johnson, were approached by officers for questioning regarding a recent gang-related shooting. Romero and Johnson were both shot after Romero allegedly went for a gun in his waistband. Romero died from his wounds. It was later discovered that the weapon was a pellet gun.[82]

properties.name: Tobin, Marshall
properties.description: A 911 call about domestic violence led police to a Safeway where they identified Tobin from the caller's description. Officers said they could see Tobin's handgun, and after he refused to put his hands on top of his vehicle they tried to subdue him with a taser. Tobin then allegedly reached for his handgun, and the officers shot him to death.[107]

properties.name: Davis, Joseph (29)
properties.description: Officers recognized a parked car from a pursuit a few weeks earlier, and when Davis came outside and saw police, he fled and allegedly flashed a handgun at them. He was able to get to his car and a five-mile chase ensued, ending when Davis tried to carjack another vehicle. Three officers fired at Davis, killing him, after he fired into the vehicle he was trying to jack.[19]

properties.name: Combs, Douglas (16)
properties.description: Authorities with Vancouver Police and Clark County Sheriff's Office were investigating a home invasion shooting that injured one and two armed robberies from earlier that day when they confronted Douglas E. Combs and another 16-year-old near East 19th Street and E Street in Vancouver. Officers believe Combs is the primary suspect in the three crimes. After attempting contact with the two 16-year-olds, police say an officer shot Combs. Officers said Combs had been armed at the time of the shooting, and was pronounced dead at the scene.[10]

properties.name: Lookabill, Nikkolas W.
properties.description: Shot after refusing to commands to drop weapon. Police were responding to report of a man walking the neighborhood armed with a handgun[31]

properties.name: Mestler, Peter (53)
properties.description: Mestler was shot to death by officers after allegedly refusing to drop a gun he was holding, which turned out to be a BB gun. Police say he was upset because his wife was divorcing him, and that he had pulled the gun on several other people before officers confronted him.[12]

properties.name: France, Jesse J. (28)
properties.description: Members of a U.S. Marshals Fugitive Task Force shot Mr. France through the windshield of his car after he "escalated the situation" when the marshals located him. One witness claimed Mr. France's face "was kind of blown off."[21][22][23]

properties.name: Parker, Dante (36)
properties.description: Sheriff's deputies found Parker riding a bicycle away from the residence and tried to stop him, but he appeared to be under the influence of unknown substances and became "uncooperative and combative," officials said. Parker allegedly fought with a female deputy and left bruises on her arms. The deputy used a Taser on Parker "multiple times" during a struggle, officials said. A second deputy helped handcuff Parker and place him in the backseat of a patrol unit, when they saw that he was sweating and breathing heavily, authorities said.[35]

properties.name: Vanderbeek, Jacob
properties.description: Officer attempted to stop suspect for a traffic violation. During an 80 mile chase suspect dropped out of his vehicle a hand grenade that was later determined to be inert. Upon stopping the suspect produced what appeared to be a weapon. Suspect was shot once by an officer.[63]

properties.name: Newcomb, Daniel Guy (33)
properties.description: Officers were chasing Newcomb as a robbery suspect. He pointed a gun at the officers who shot and killed him. It was later determined that the gun was a toy submachine gun.[13]

properties.name: Hannowsky, Christopher Lee (31)
properties.description: A gang-enforcement officer confronted the man because he appeared to be holding a knife. The two men got into a struggle. During the struggle the suspect allegedly took control of the officer's taser. The officer then drew his firearm, and fatally shot the man.[35]

properties.name: Nelson, Richard (52)
properties.description: After rear-ending a bus Nelson was seen drinking in his car by a nearby police officer. The police officer gave pursuit and Nelson began to drive erratically. According to Hawaii News Now, witnesses were said to have seen him make U-turns, put his car in reverse, and drive on sidewalks. The pursuing officer then shot Nelson to prevent injuries to others nearby.[1]

properties.name: Elders, Kollin
properties.description: Shot during confrontation in restaurant which was apparently not work related. A State Department special agent was charged with second-degree murder and released on $250,000 bail.[27]

properties.name: Lacy, Christopher Boone (36)
properties.description: Lacy was pulled over by a California Highway Patrol officer. Lacy shot and fatally wounded the officer. Another officer approached the vehicle from the passenger side and fatally shot the suspect. Lacy died later that day in the hospital. Officer Kenyon M. Youngstrom, 37, died from his wounds on September 5, 2012.[73][74]

properties.name: Banta, Anthony Jr (22)
properties.description: Police responded to a call during which a woman could be heard screaming. Officers report they were forced to shoot an armed man who was pronounced dead at the scene.[4][5]

properties.name: Cornelio Morales, Alberto (41)
properties.description: A gunman shot and injured a Los Angeles County Sheriff's deputy at 4 am., and after a manhunt was found hiding in a dumpster. Victim was Latino.[54][55]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Shot while attempting to pull a weapon out of a coat pocket. The man was approached as a possible suspect in a recent burglary. When the man was ordered to remove his hands from his pockets a scuffle ensued.[175]

properties.name: Sides, Jon M. (32)
properties.description: Jon Sides was shot and killed by a Warr Acres Police officer after a motorcycle chase that began in Warr Acres and ended in southwest Oklahoma City.[41]

properties.name: Walker, Taemarr
properties.description: Police shot and killed Walker after he pointed a handgun at an officer.[30]

properties.name: Brown, Robert (26)
properties.description: Brown was shot and killed in southeast D.C. by police after taking out a weapon in front of officers. Officers attempted to question Brown regarding a homicide investigation.[10]

properties.name: Campbell, Dominique (41)
properties.description: Officers were looking for a suspect involved in an earlier shooting. Campbell fired on the officers, injuring one. The officers returned fire, killing Campbell.[27]

properties.name: Rawls, Anthony (49)
properties.description: Police allegedly received a call that Rawls had a gun and was threatening his wife. Officers shot and killed him outside his home.[11]

properties.name: Crestwell, Chester Joseph Jr (44)
properties.description: Police approached a suspect regarding an attempted abduction several days prior. The suspect shot at the officer, who returned fire, killing the man.[33]

properties.name: Payton, Albert Jermaine (24)
properties.description: A man with a knife was killed during a confrontation with police.[28]

properties.name: Bolden, Kevin (19)
properties.description: Officers responded to report of drug activity and approached a group of people. One man ran and police pursued. The man drew a gun. Shots were exchanged and the man died at the scene.[2]

properties.name: Carey, Miriam (34)
properties.description: Miriam Carey, a dental hygienist from Stamford, Connecticut, attempted to drive through a White House security checkpoint in her black Infiniti G37 coupe, struck a U.S. Secret Service officer, and was chased by the Secret Service to the United States Capitol where she was fatally shot by law enforcement officers. See United States Capitol shooting incident (2013).[35][36]

properties.name: Ambrose, Derrick, Jr. (22)
properties.description: Police were responding to a report of a fight with possible shots fired and spotted Ambrose with a gun. Ambrose allegedly refused to drop the weapon and fled down the street. Officer Kyle Law pursued Ambrose and shot him in the head when he stepped out from behind a tree. Ambrose had a permit to carry weapons. The investigation of this incident is being submitted to a grand jury.[13]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Officers responded to report of a man with a gun at a hotel. When the officers arrived, the man pulled out a handgun. An officer fired one shot, killing him.[14]

properties.name: Robertson, Jack
properties.description: Robertson was shot by police after he allegedly lunged at them with meat fork and knife.[34]

properties.name: Shaw, James
properties.description: Shot while dragging officer with vehicle. Officers had approached Shaw to question him regarding reports of violent threats. The officer had reached inside Shaw's car to stop it.[98]

properties.name: Alex Cora De Jesus (35)
properties.description: De Jesus was running away from the scene of a drug bust when he was shot in the temple by an officer. De Jesus was not armed. The attorney general investigated and was unable to determine if the killing was justified, but did issue a highly critical report. The city paid $300,000 to De Jesus' family in exchange for them not filing a wrongful death suit.[14]

properties.name: Henning, Steven (32)
properties.description: Police were called after an act of arson was committed by a man in front of a bus station. When police made contact with the suspect, Steven Henning, he refused to extinguish the fire acted aggressively and violently resisted arrest. Henning attempted to steal the officers' police car, and was subdued by pepper spray. Afterward, he violently resisted arrest again, grabbed an officer's Taser, and then fled on foot. The Weed Police, Siskiyou Sheriff’s office and California Highway Patrol searched for Henning and found him near a freeway overpass. After an attempt to subdue him with a law enforcement canine unit, Henning continued to violently resist arrest and attempted to injure the canine. The officer and deputy discharged their firearms and Henning was killed.[16][17]

properties.name: Harris, Robert J. (43)
properties.description: A Wenatchee police officer shot and killed Harris in a parking lot after a controlled drug buy that went bad.[4][5]

properties.name: Rutkowski, Jonathan D. (20)
properties.description: 20-year-old Jonathan D. Rutkowski carried two handguns in his pants while walking in Wernersville, a small borough west of Reading. A witness saw Rutkowski, a resident of the borough, carrying the guns and called police. Officers from Western Berks Regional, Lower Heidelberg Township, Sinking Spring Borough, and South Heidelberg Township police departments responded and ordered Rutkowski to drop his guns. Ignoring their orders, he fled on foot. Police chased Rutkowski to an isolated spot along Norfolk Southern Railroad tracks, just south of Route 422 which traverses the borough. Continuing to ignore commands to put down the guns, Rutkowski allegedly pointed the guns at the officers who opened fire. Rutkowski had Aspergers Syndrome, a mild form of autism characterized by social awkwardness and non-compliant behavior that could have contributed to the incident. He sustained multiple handgun and shotgun wounds and died at the scene. Rutkowski never fired the guns, a semi-automatic pistol and a revolver, which were unloaded.[8]

properties.name: Patterson, Henry (55)
properties.description: Police knocked on Patterson's door to arrest him for aggravated stalking at about 9 p.m. Police shot and killed the Patterson, who was armed, according to neighbors.[30]

properties.name: Mays, Tracy (29)
properties.description: An off-duty police officer attended a graduation party with Mays. The two began to argue, then he shot Mays. The officer then shot himself and was hospitalized.[38]

properties.name: Foote, Jeff (39)
properties.description: Foote was killed by officers after allegedly firing a shot at them with a small handgun he was brandishing in his parent's front yard. He was threatening to shoot himself.[14]

properties.name: Alexis, Aaron (34)
properties.description: Alexis was killed in a gunbattle with police during the Washington Navy Yard shooting, which killed 12 people and injured 3 others.[22]

properties.name: Hendrix, Daquan (19)
properties.description: Metropolitan Police and Federal Agents were preparing to serve a homicide arrest warrant on the suspect when he emerged from a residence firing a handgun and was fatally shot by police.[7]

properties.name: Zehm, Otto
properties.description: Otto Zehm

properties.name: Musto, Douglas S. (27)
properties.description: Police received a domestic disturbance call when Musto reportedly tried to kick down his ex-girlfriend's door. Officers shot him to death after he allegedly stabbed an officer who was trying to handcuff him.[36]

properties.name: Stahl, David "D.J." W., II (20)
properties.description: Three officers in two vehicles attempted a traffic stop on Stahl who was driving at a high rate of speed. Stahl allegedly rammed one of the cruisers. Two officers from the other cruiser approached Stahl's vehicle on foot in an attempt to arrest him. Sheriff’s Deputy Ernest Snyder shot and killed Stahl when he accelerated toward them, police say.[2]

properties.name: Brown, Lamar Anthony (39)
properties.description: Responding to a complaint of a bike robbery, police say Brown tussled with West Palm Beach police officer Jason Rafael Barquin, deflected a Taser strike and opened fire at Barquin who shot and killed Brown.[13]

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Officers responded to report that a man had fatally shot his girlfriend. The man shot at and injured an officer. Other officers returned fire, killing the man.[73]

properties.name: Willard, Danielle (21)
properties.description: Willard was shot and killed by undercover officer Shaun Cowley of the West Valley City Police Department in the parking lot of an apartment complex.[44] Cowley and his partner Kevin Salmon opened fire at Willard's car, claiming that she tried to run them over. Salt Lake County district attorney Sim Gill determined that the shooting was legally unjustified[45] before filing manslaughter charges against Cowley in June 2014.[46] Willard's mother, Melissa Kennedy, said she hoped for murder charges but was satisfied with Gill's decision. Salmon was not charged as none of his shots hit Willard.[47] Cowley was also fired after the shooting, but for mishandling evidence related to the case rather than for the shooting itself.[48]

properties.name: Piccard, Thomas
properties.description: Piccard was shot and killed by a Wheeling police officer and a US court security officer. He had allegedly fired over 20 rounds into the federal courthouse building with an assault rifle. Piccard had retired from the Wheeling Police Department in 2000 after more than 20 years as an officer.[33]

properties.name: Chamberlain Sr., Kenneth
properties.description: Shot in his home by police responding to an automated medical alert.[22]

properties.name: Montgomery, Robert (29)
properties.description: Officers attempted to arrest Montgomery on charges of homicide. Montgomery shot and wounded one officer. Police returned fire, killing Montgomery.[47]

properties.name: Johnston, Daniel (58)
properties.description: Police were responding to a report of a man acting in a threatening manner. Officers arrived and found Johnston armed with a hatchet, and after a confrontation where Johnston refused to drop the hatchet, they shot and killed him.[8]

properties.name: Roland, Ronald (18) & Robinson, Tevin (20)
properties.description: Three men forced a Pizza Hut employee who was outside back inside at gunpoint and robbed those inside the restaurant. Police arrived on scene, and the three suspects ignored the commands of the police and engaged into a shootout. Two of the robbers were killed, and a third was wounded. No officers were injured.[8]

properties.name: Denk, Gracie Louise (21)
properties.description: A Wilmington police officer fired 4 rounds into Dank's car.

properties.name: unnamed male
properties.description: Shot after threatening police with a knife. Police were responding to report of armed suicidal person and attempted to disarm man with Taser.[107]

properties.name: Colbert, DeJuan
properties.description: Officers were responding to a robbery alarm at a Dollar General store. 27-year-old Colbert was allegedly standing at the door with a knife, and approached the officer who commanded him to drop it. That officer shot and killed Colbert.[29]

properties.name: Collins, Timothy F., Jr. (17)
properties.description: Collins was shot in the head by police during a home invasion.[21][22]

properties.name: Smart, Marquez (23)
properties.description: Officers began chasing Smart when he happened to run toward them after allegedly firing at least two shots from a semi-automatic handgun. Officers fired at him multiple times when he refused to drop the weapon and eventually shot him to death in an alley. Four other people, three of them teenagers, were wounded by gunfire either from Smart or the officers.[21]

properties.name: Lanning, Troy, Jr. (24)
properties.description: Officers were looking for a white vehicle after receiving a report of a drive-by shooting. They spotted a white car speeding and attempted a traffic stop, and a 7-minute chase ensued. The vehicle was disabled after driving over a curb, and four people fled on foot. One officer chased Lanning over a fence into a backyard. Lanning was carrying a bag and allegedly reaching into it and the officer shot him several times, killing him. No weapons were found in Lanning's belongings or in the vehicle.[45]

properties.name: Pierre, Daniel (42)
properties.description: Described by relatives having "struggled with drug addiction," Pierre was shot and killed by Winslow Township police, who declined to say why they’d been called there.[87]

properties.name: Conner, Dallas Antwan (29)
properties.description: Shot by a plainclothes officer during an armed robbery of car dealership.[52]

properties.name: Henderson, Mark (19)
properties.description: At a Red Roof Inn, Henderson was shot multiple times by three officers when they thought he was armed and non-compliant. Police say they did not find a weapon on Henderson's body. Another man allegedly was armed and ended up holding people hostage; a SWAT team was able to negotiate a surrender and he was taken into custody.[4]

properties.name: Towe, Jeffrey (53)
properties.description: Man lunged at officers with a knife and was shot. Family reported to media a long history of mental illness.[27]

properties.name: Jimenez, Brandon Lee Macias (26)
